summary: Debate: NAP is flawed and unnecessary [SOHO Forum] David Friedman, Gene Epstein, Dennis Pratt [Pav]
description: For Whom: Lovers of the age-old libertarian debate between libertarian consequentialists and ethicists Description: Resolution: The right way to persuade people of libertarianism is by showing them that its outcomes are superior by their standards, without any resort to the flawed non-agression principle (NAP). Affirmative: David Friedman, An American economist, legal scholar, and anarcho-capitalist theorist, author of six non-fiction books, many articles and three novels. His most popular book is The Machinery of Freedom: Guide to a Radical Capitalism. href="www.daviddfriedman.com"> Website . href="https://i.imgur.com/beVXLM0.jpg"> Image Negative: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. . href="www.thesohoforum.org"> Website . href="https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58ac6b92414fb5aa5de25b89/1540759502298-Z8YOG2CTZ4PMJF87R4DR/HeadShot_Square.jpg?format=1000w"> Image Moderator: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest XX 2023. This year's NH's Liberty Activist of the Year and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. He was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before moving to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer to create the Libertarian Homeland, starting liberty clubhouses including the famous SHELL, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the LPNH, and tweeting about liberarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks at Libety 101 on libertarianism.. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website When: Fri, 12:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: What underlies libertarianism? And what is the best way to explain it to newbies? Two greats go head to head on whether consequentialism or ethics are the proper way to position libertarianism.

summary: Easier to Convert: Homosexuality OR Libertarianism Jeremy Kauffman, Matt Kibbe, Gene Epstein [Pav]
description: For Whom: Have you been frustrated with converting people to libertarianism? Perhaps it's because it may harder than converting someone to homosexuality? Kauffman v. Kibbe square off on the recent question: Which is more innate: sexual or political orientation? Description: Resolution: "It would be easier to convert a heterosexual to homosexuality than to convert a non-libertarian to libertarianism" Affirmative: Jeremy Kauffman, Founder and CEO of Lbry and Odyssee, Jeremy is on the Board of the Free State Project. He ran for US Senate from NH, and is himself a free state mover with his wife and children. Jeremy has been failing to convert nonlibertarians to libertarianism for years, but while dating, proved to be surprisingly good at converting heterosexual women to homosexuality.. href="https://twitter.com/jeremykauffman"> Website . href="https://www.findinggeniuspodcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/podcast-small-image-11-277x200.jpg"> Image Negative: Matt Kibbe, Matthew B. Kibbe is the President of Free the People and of Fight the Power Productions, and host of BlazeTV’s Kibbe on Liberty. He founded FreedomWorks, was senior advisor for a Rand Paul Presidential Super PAC Chief of Staff to U.S. Representative Dan Miller (R-FL), Budget Director for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, and Senior Economist for the RNC. Among other books, he authored, the number 2 New York Times bestseller "Don’t Hurt People and Don’t Take Their Stuff". MSNBC’s Keith Olbermann called Kibbe “The second worst person in the world.” Graduate work in economics at George Mason, a B.A. in economics from Grove City College, Matt is DeadHead and a beer and whiskey connoisseur and apologist. He should be living in the Free State with his awesome wife Terry, and three objectivist cats.. href="https://freethepeople.org/author/mkibbe/"> Website . href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Kibbenumber /media/File:Matt_Kibbe_by_Gage_Skidmore_2.jpg"> Image Moderator: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. He is contemplating a second home in the Free State with wife and artists Hisako Kobayashi.. href="https://www.thesohoforum.org"> Website . href="https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58ac6b92414fb5aa5de25b89/1540759502298-Z8YOG2CTZ4PMJF87R4DR/HeadShot_Square.jpg?format=1000w"> Image When: Thu, 12:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field

For Whom: Any attendees to the Porcupine Freedom Festival who really want to roll up their sleeves and help build freedom. This is a awesome way for newbies to meet people! Description: Volunteer to help your PorcFest volunteers unpack the truck, and set up for the week of festival. The Porcupine Freedom Festival is created by volunteers like you, and you can become one of them! . . . Come down to the Pavillion and help us unload, unpack, setup. . . . Meet all the movers and shakers of the most successful freedom movement who volunteer to dedicate their time to create actual freedom in an all-too-authoritarian world Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) . . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. . . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. href="https://www.independencerealtynh.com"> Website . href="https://i4.moxi.onl/img-pr/a/4600e182-cc2c-4940-b9b8-8c8b30a1ba3d/0_2_full.jpg"> Image When: Mon, 1:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: ( We'll need your help packing up as well on Sunday!! )

Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. href="https://www.independencerealtynh.com"> Website . href="https://www.amazon.com/photos/shared/nX5q1bAmRd-wZXaAjuXMOA.4R627B63-BjOzf19edUvRR"> Image Chef de Village, PorcFest XX 2023: Dennis Pratt, This is Dennis' fifth and final year volunteering to coordinate PorcFest, and his third year as co-producer/"Chef de Village". He is in charge of positioning, events, hubs, speakers, sponsors, marketing, and revenues. . . . Dennis reimagined PorcFest in 2020 to align more with our FSP goals to attract liberty lovers to the Free State, and to connect and activate those liberty lovers to build greater liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Dennis_Pratt-e6842a6532f05875e4f99145c8123f14.png"> Image When: Sun, 9:00A (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Volunteers meet every day at 9AM

For Whom: Those would enjoy the piss and vinegar of a great anti-authoritarian rant, and those who can deliver it!
Description: Bring YOUR best 3-minute rant to be judged by an esteemed panel of celebertarian judges, moderated by Queen Quill herself, Carla Gericke (usually in a compromised condition.)
. . . Now in its 11th year, don't miss the ultimate crowd favorite SoapBox Idol! Prepare your best 3-minute rant on the topic of your choice. Whatever really bugs you, here is your chance to bitch to -- and convince -- a receptive audience.
. . . The top Idolers will do their best to impress their passion and insight on the audience and a panel of esteemed judges. Your applause selects the final winner. 
Queen Quill: Carla Gericke, The Queen herself presides over the PorcFest favorite event that she invented and has presided over for more than a decade. Carla is a superb ranter herself - on the House floor, at traffic stops, and in courtrooms - she is looking for new raw talent, as well as inspiring older talent to new heights
When: Sat, 6:00P (150m)
Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field
Note: This event is not suitable for sensitive ears.
Loud encouragement from the audience is appreciated.
You MUST audition (10A at the Queen Quill tent each day) to secure a coveted spot atop the soapbox on Saturday.

summary: Panel: NBC Producers on Free State Project Shira Stoll, Dan Ferrigan, Erica Jorgensen, Dennis Pratt [Pav]
description: For Whom: People interested in the Free State Project, in Main Stream Media press coverage of libertarianism, and in long-form documentaries of controversial subjects. Description: Hear the expectations and the experiences of the Producers who embedded eight months for a documentary of the Free State Project, and ask questions. . . . "Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of New Hampshire follows a libertarian political migration known as the Free State Project. Twenty years ago, one man penned a manifesto encouraging 20,000 libertarians to sign a pledge and move to the Granite State for more freedom. Now “The Free State Project” is shaking up politics and communities in New Hampshire and growing in strength and numbers." Co-Director, Producer, Cinematographer: Shira Stoll, Shira Stoll is the Co-Director + Producer of Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of New Hampshire. She is a regional Emmy and Murrow award winning video producer and journalist on the Special Projects + Streaming unit at NBC10 Boston working on long form narratives and investigative stories. . . . Shira was awarded a 2022 Regional Edward R. Murrow Award for her role on the project “Where I’m Really From,” a 2022 New England Emmy for The Chinatown Massacre documentary and a 2019 New York Emmy for Where Life Leads You: Stories of Staten Island’s Holocaust survivors.. href="https://twitter.com/ShiraStoll "> Website Co-Director, Producer, Cinematographer: Dan Ferrigan, Award-winning photojournalist and filmmaker Dan Ferrigan is the Co-Director + Producer of Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of New Hampshire. . . . Dan has worked around the world in nonfiction storytelling. Traveling to India, Dan worked on India: A New Life, commissioned by PBS-Frontline World. In 2008, India: A New Life received three Telly awards. Dan worked with New England Cable News (NECN) in Norway to shoot the 2010 AP award-winning documentary, Unequal Justice? The Joseph Donovan Story. Dan was the cinematographer on the Emmy-nominated documentary THE WAY WE GET BY released theatrically in July 2009, playing in over 60 cities nationwide. The film had its world premiere at the South By Southwest Film Festival (SXSW) in March 2009 and won the Special Jury Award. THE WAY WE GET BY has won 18 festival awards to date. Dan grew up in Winslow, Maine, and currently resides in Needham, Massachusetts.. href="https://twitter.com/DanFerrigan"> Website Executive Producer: Erica Jorgensen, Erica Jorgensen is the Executive Producer Special Projects + Streaming at NBC10 Boston I Telemundo Boston I NECN at NBCUniversal Media, LLC. Moderator: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest XX 2023, this year's NH's Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. He was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before moving to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer to create the Libertarian Homeland, starting liberty clubhouses including the famous SHELL, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the LPNH, and tweeting about liberarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks on libertarianism at Libety 101.. href="https://www.fsp.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Voluntaryist-Heart-only.jpg"> Website . href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Image When: Fri, 6:30P _(90m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: A 30 minute subset (two of 11 episodes) of the docuseries will be played at 6P on Friday to whet your appetite, watch together, and remind you before the panel discussion. . . . The full docuseries will have been played on Tuesday night in the Liberty 101 at 6P. . . . And you may pre-view the series before you come to PorcFest by following the above link to NBC Boston for Free State Project docuseries. href="https://www.nbcboston.com/news/local/coming-soon-life-liberty-and-the-pursuit-of-new-hampshire/2961708/">More Info

summary: Maj Toure - Black Guns Matter Maj Touré [Pav]
description: For Whom: Second amendment advocates and dissenters. Description: Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. Speaker: Maj Touré, Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. href="https://solutionarylifestyle.org/"> Website . href="https://solutionarylifestyle.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/maj-shot.jpg"> Image When: Thu, 4:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Maj Toure is rumored to be a potential VP candidate on the 2024 Libertarian ticket. href="https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100015026555306">More Info

summary: Anatomy of the Coup D'Etat Jeffrey Tucker [Pav]
description: For Whom: TBD Description: The real history of our times is shrouded in secrecy but we know enough to piece it together. There was an overthrown of civilian government in this country and its replacement by a military-baed biomedical security state. The crisis is urgent and the solution must begin with knowledge. Speaker: Jeffrey Tucker, Founder and President of the Brownstone Institute, Jeffrey is the author of many thousands of articles in the scholarly and popular press and ten books in 5 languages, most recently Liberty or Lockdown. He is also the editor of The Best of Mises. He speaks widely on topics of economics, technology, social philosophy, and culture. . href="https://brownstone.org/about/"> Website . href="https://www.aier.org/wp-content/webpc-passthru.php?src=https://www.aier.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/porcfest-2020-jeffrey-tucker.jpg"> Image When: Sat, 4:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://brownstone.org/about/">More Info

For Whom: Libertarian Party members, potential movers, lover of "mean tweets" and haters of mass murder. Description: Reed's beliefs and friendships were put to the test when he made a post mocking Meghan McCain on the anniversary of her father’s death and drew condemnation from all corners of the political spectrum, including his own. Join Reed as he reflects about his re-integration into the Free State, a Libertarian Homeland that has advanced far further than he remembered it when he left. Speaker: Reed Coverdale, Reed Coverdale is a blue collar worker, trucker, power lineman, podcaster, and "re-mover" to the Free State, who spent a good portion of 2022 helping liberty win in NH by contributing to Jeremy Kauffman’s Senate run, and to social media for the Libertarian Party of NH. When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://linktr.ee/ReedCoverdale">More Info

summary: The Croydon Budget Battle Ian Underwood, Jody Underwood [Pav]
description: For Whom: Interested in school reform, school choice, battles over property taxes and monied interests, breaking the indoctrination camps. Description: In 2022, the town of Croydon NH voted to replace the usual ransom demanded by the school administration with a budget offered by the taxpayers. The point of this change was to force the serious consideration of a number of fundamental questions about education that never get considered under the ransom model of funding. Unfortunately, the conversation was quickly derailed into a referendum about Free Staters. We'll discuss what actually happened in Croydon (beyond what the media reported) and our lessons learned. There will also be a never-heard-before epilogue! We'll continue the conversation at Firesteel at 3pm to brainstorm how we can win the war even though we lost the battle. Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. href="https://www.bareminimumbooks.com/"> Website . href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Ian_Underwood-2a83158be6e3275c2ac6d2951ac2d288.png"> Image Host: Jody Underwood, Jody served on the Croydon School Board from 2010-2023 and was chair when this budget battle took place. In addition, she: . . . shepherded a bill through the NH legislature to clarify the law to allow private schools to be included in town tuitioning agreements. She is a founding board member of the School District Governance Association of NH (sdganh.org), whose mission is to help school board members discover their powers so they don’t get overrun by administrators. . . has written research papers about how New Hampshire uses tax dollars for private schools and about how town tuitioning works in New Hampshire. She has delivered presentations about town tuitioning and school choice around the state. . . in her day job, from which she has recently retired, conducted research and development of technology to support learning and assessment in the classroom since 1988. . . and her husband moved to New Hampshire in 2007, where they live on a large off-grid property in Croydon.. href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Jody_Underwood-46c5c206b2afe6563f6a6b0a821894b2.png"> Image When: Wed, 2:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://granitegrok.com/blog/2022/03/budget-or-ransom">More Info

Wednesday 3PM-4PM PAV Speaker: Elizabeth Duffy. href="https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1618654211796881410/pu/img/1yQp0AQa0f4a_1ye?format=jpg&name=large"> Image When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Language may not be suitable for young audiences. href="https://www.youtube.com/@taxthispodcast">More Info

summary: FSP: The Good, The Fab and the Fugly Carla Gericke [Pav]
description: For Whom: Free Staters, Wanna-be-Free Staters, and people who wish they could be Free Staters. Description: Twenty years have come and gone, and we're only getting started! Where are we now and where are we going? Join Carla as she reflects on the end of the beginning, and what her vision is for the next 20 years in the Free State. Big goals require big dreams. Come discover how we can make New Hampshire our libertarian homeland. Live free and thrive! Speaker: Carla Gericke, Carla is an early mover and OG, taking executive and volunteer roles within the FSP since 2008, as well as leading efforts to make New Hampshire more free by serving on boards and running for office. Carla is affectionately known as ‘Queen Quill’, is the Chair of the Free State Project, lead producer of numerous PorcFests, and constant volunteer. She spearheads innumerable liberty efforts in the Free State, including issues relating to 1st, 2nd, 4th and 10th Amendment issues, government accountability/transparency, and how to Live Free and Thrive!. href="https://www.carlagericke.com/"> Website When: Thu, 5:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://www.carlagericke.com/">More Info

For Whom: People who want to make Liberty in Our Lifetime happen Description: October 1, 2003 was the date we announced New Hampshire’s selection as the Free State. Contrary to expectations, liberty lovers started moving right away. Thousands have now moved and gotten active. What impact have we had? What impact will we have over the next 20 years? Speaker: Jason Sorens, The Free State Project was founded in 2001 by Jason Sorens, then a Ph.D. student at Yale University. Jason was studying independence movements in other countries and thinking about how liberty-minded folk could have an impact as a small minority in the world and the U.S. Jason published an article in The Libertarian Enterprise highlighting the failure of libertarians to elect any candidate to federal office and outlining his ideas for a migration movement that continues an American tradition of political migration, which includes groups such as Mormon settlers in Utah, Amish religious communities, and the "Jamestown Seventy", an earlier effort to influence the politics of a particular state through deliberate migration. Jason's essay eventually became the founding document of the Free State Project. In it, Jason proposed a mass migration, a voluntary resettlement of 20,000 libertarians, anarchists, anarcho-capitalists, pacifists, even freedom-minded Democrats and Republicans, to a single, relatively liberty-friendly state, where they could establish a beachhead of personal and economic freedom. Today, Jason is Senior Research Faculty at AIER and lives with his family in Amherst, New Hampshire. When: Fri, 11:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://www.fsp.org">More Info

summary: Doing What Must Be Done Jeremy Kauffman [Pav]
description: For Whom: People curious about the history and strategy of the Free State movement, Free State skeptics, Free State newbies, people who like bad jokes Description: Libertarians are a dominated political minority. They are isolated, surrounded, and sometimes so depressed they think there is no hope. In this talk, we'll look at why that is, why the Free State movement is a solution to these fundamental problems, and where the movement goes from here. Speaker: Jeremy Kauffman, Founder of LBRY and Odysee, Jeremy is on the Board of the Free State Project. He ran for US Senate from NH, and is himself a Free State mover with his wife and 4 children.. href="kauffj.com"> Website When: Sat, 11:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="twitter.com/jeremykauffman">More Info

description: For Whom: Anyone who thinks "Beijing Biden" is soft on China. Contrarily, they are quite happy to brag about basically any escalation they can get. summary: Privacy: How to reclaim your digital life Naomi Brockwell [Pav]
description: For Whom: This presentation is for anyone who wants to learn how to be more empowered in their digital life, and better understand the technology that they use. It's for those who understand why privacy is essential for a free society, but who don't know where to begin in their privacy journey. Description: Naomi Brockwell is a tech journalist, and creator of "NBTV.media", a tech channel with 700k subscribers across platforms. In this presentation she'll walk people through how to reclaim control of their lives in the digital age. She'll go through basic and more advanced tools that people can use to take back their data, money, and free online expression. Speaker: Naomi Brockwell, Naomi Brockwell is a tech journalist, and creator of "NBTV.media". NBTV teaches people how to reclaim control of their lives in the digital age. The channel gives people the tools they need to take back their data, money, and free online expression. From 2013 - 2015 she worked as a policy associate at the New York Bitcoin Center. From 2015 - 2021 she has worked as a producer for 19-times Emmy-Award-Winning Journalist John Stossel. From 2021 to 2022 she hosted the CoinDesk series “Break it Down”, and the CoinDesk daily show “The Hash”. Naomi was a producer for the 2015 feature documentary Bitcoin: The End of Money as We Know It (Best International Documentary, Anthem Film Festival; Winner of Special Jury Prize, Amsterdam Film Festival), and producer of the 2018 award-winning documentary about the housing crash The Bubble. Naomi is the co-founder of “The Soho Forum”, a NY debate series. She is on the Advisory Council at the “Mannkal Economic Education Foundation”, and is author of “Beginner's Introduction To Privacy”, and the children's book “Billy's Bitcoin”.. href="NBTV.media"> Website When: Fri, 10:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="NBTV.media">More Info

Join with them as they sing, dance, and blast their tracks with music videos for liberty! Singer: The Pholosopher, The Pholosopher is a multimedia personality teaching others about Voluntaryist philosophy. Her talents span a variety of creative outlets including memes, skits, educational videos, and music. Of note, her video, “Taxation is Theft,” has some 4 million hits on Being Libertarian, and her gun rights video, “3 Common Gun Control Myths Debunked,” has nearly 6 million views. She’s been especially vocal against the tyrannical lockdowns with her music video, Mask Order, reaching over 120,000 listens on YouTube alone. She hopes her work inspires others to be peaceful, principled people.. href="https://thepholosopher.com/"> Website . href="https://www.facebook.com/dapholosopher/photos/a.838982989579881/2794624540682373/"> Image Singer: Jack Lloyd, Jack Lloyd is a producer for liberty, creating content for The Pholosopher, Voluntaryist – The Comic Series, and The Honest Teacher, among others. He recently debuted his lead in the song ANTISTATE and is working to produce his next music video, Break the Great Reset.. href="https://volcomic.com"> Website . href="https://www.facebook.com/jackvoluntaryist/photos/a.106728538418666/181002590991260/"> Image When: Tue, 6:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Excited to see you at the PAV!

Description: Join Matt and Terry Kibbe for a glass, or two, of delicious Georgian wine and hear the story of an 8000 year wine-making tradition almost destroyed when mass murderer Josef Stalin seized and destroyed ancient Georgian vineyards, replacing them with cheap,sweet, high alcohol plonk. Part drunk history, part Austrian economics in a glass, from Stalin’s Swill to the true “grapeness” of liberty reborn. summary: A Libertarian Walks into A Socialist Karlyn Borysenko [Pav]
description: For Whom: If you're interested in the dark underbelly that is driving politics and culture, this event will teach you things you won't see anywhere else. Description: For almost a year, I've been investigating real socialists groups around the country. But a few months ago, I took it one step further and went undercover for a full day at a socialists reproductive justice conference in Massachuetts. I went to their workshops, I talked to them about their ideas, I connected with their organizations. And now I'm going to share what I learned. There is a real enemy out there, and they want to rule us. Speaker: Karlyn Borysenko, Karlyn Borysenko is the author of Actively Unwoke: The Ultimate Guide For Fighting Back Against Woke Insanity In Your Life. She has broken multiple nationally covered news stores exposing the far left ideology in corporate America and government schools and her work has garnered over 50 million views in the past few years. Karlyn does keep dives on far-left socialists on her YouTube channel and exposes what they say when they think we're not listening.. href="https://unwokeart.com"> Website When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="https://unwokeart.com">More Info

For Whom: This talk is especially for those frustrated by politics, disillusioned with the human race, and pessimistic about the future. Description: The game of politics, and the specter of authoritarian domination, have been around for so long that most people--even some of the most zealous advocates of freedom--have a difficult time imagining that society can and will ever fundamentally change. But it will. And it will probably be a lot sooner than you think, and will look a lot different than what you may imagine. summary: Is Deep State Penetrable: Free The People Vivek Ramaswamy, Matt Kibbe [Pav]
description: For Whom: Think DC reformable? Interested in the 2023 Presidential contest? Curious about Vivek? Want to unseat the deep State Description: < E.g., Does the Deep State? Is it reformable? Matt Kibbe will interview Vivek Ramaswamy, [R] candidate for President about his intention to dismantle the Deep State. The Free State Project attracts libertarians who wish to separate from the DC overlords because many of us don't believe DC is ever able to be libertated. Vivek disagrees; he promises to remove 75% of the deep state. Can anyone do this? Matt Kibbe will conduct a special Free The People broadcast from the Big Stage of PorcFest to explore the existenc, strength, and reformability of the Deep State. He will also ask this candidate about this other libertarian and not-so-libertarian proposals. Your questions can probe deeper. Interviewee: Vivek Ramaswamy, Vivek Ramaswamy is the first millennial to run for the Republican nomination for president. He is an American business leader and the author of books including Woke, Inc.: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam and Capitalist Punishment: How Wall Street is Using Your Money to Create a Country You Didn't Vote For. ‍ The media has called him the "intellectual godfathers of the anti-woke movement." Vivek helped identify and popularize discussion of wokeism in mainstream conservative thought. Born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio, Vivek was valedictorian of his high school, went on to graduate summa cum laude in Biology from Harvard and received his J.D. from Yale Law School, while working at a hedge fund. He later started a biotech company, Roivant Sciences, where he oversaw the development of five drugs that went on to become FDA-approved. In 2022, he founded Strive, an Ohio-based asset management firm that directly competes with asset managers like BlackRock, State Street, Vanguard and others, use the money of everyday citizens to advance environmental and social agendas that many citizens and capital owners disagree with. Vivek is married to Apoorva, a throat surgeon and Assistant Professor at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center. They live in Columbus, Ohio where they are raising their two sons. . href="vivek2024.com"> Website Interviewer: Matt Kibbe, When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field href="vivek2024.com">More Info

summary: Pre-Release Screening "Jones Plantation" Feature Film Andrew Treglia, Larken Rose [Pav]
description: For Whom: Who should attend? Do you believe that governments and central banks are the enemy of people? Do you believe the current governmental systems run by proxy violence and paid for through extortion are illegitimate? If so, you may enjoy "Jones Plantation". Description: You can control a man for a time with brute violence, but you can never truly OWN a man until he's convinced that your word is law, and he must obey - and is virtuous for doing so. A film destined to be a cult classic, "Jones Plantation" is at the forefront of the American Dissident Cinema movement. "Jones Plantation" is an allegory and satire of the insane control system we all currently live under. The idea of the film was born when the director, Andrew Treglia, and Larken Rose met at Anarchapulco in 2020, right before the covid regime insanity began. After a grueling three years, miraculously the film is finally complete and ready for your consumption! The bad news is, a lot of the problem is probably YOU (even if you vehemently deny that). summary: The Big Prep (in New Hampshire) Constance Spencer, Kitty Michelotti, Mickey Mullin, Alu Axelman [Pav]
description: For Whom: Preppers; People concerned with helping their families survive. Description: None of us know for sure when it's coming, but we all know the government can't print money without dire consequences. Many of the FSP movers have been working for years to be prepared and will make the case that if you haven't moved yet, you need to asap to join the best community of prepared people that also share your values of libertarianism. This panel will touch on many many topics from alternative currencies (gold, silver, iron and more), homesteading, community building and what does wealth really mean if (when) the dollar collapses. We will also provide you locations throughout the week for more information about the topics we touch on during the panel. Moderator: Constance Spencer, Constance is an early mover, co-producer of the PorcFest, and parent of four. She moved to New Hampshire during a difficult time in her life and has made a large impact on a number of other Free State movers as a Realtor and founder of independence Realty Group. She tells her story of the difficulties she had to inspire others to make the move and their lives better in New Hampshire. . href="https://IndependenceRealtyNH.com"> Website Panelist: Kitty Michelotti, Panelist: Mickey Mullin, Panelist: Alu Axelman, Alu is a long-time liberty activist, speaker, and writer. He believes in being prepared for the worst. As the USD collapses, it's important to have alternatives such as crypto, gold, and silver - and to know how to use them! And: Jay Noone When: Tue, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Can you really justify to your family why you aren't in New Hampshire getting prepped?

summary: A State Freed From Government Welfare Larry Elder [Pav]
description: For Whom: Anyone interested in free-market alternatives to the welfare stat.e and the destruction America's current system has done to the black community Description: Come hear Larry Elder's vision for world without welfare and his analysis of how the welfare state has damaged the black community. Why should a new type of state - based on human liberty - reject any government control of welfare? What are the problems we'll avoid, and what are benefits we will accrue, if our Free State eliminates all government welfare? Speaker: Larry Elder, Candidate for President, Best-Selling Author, Media Figure. href="www.larryelder.com"> Website . href="https://uc7979baf43f28494710b4f670ee.previews.dropboxusercontent.com/p/thumb/AB4od-wZHbWXoFMQKjOzVJuG5hx3Of9HFOZ2PxzBgZnPpsUzNrnHFuy-NFXDBAn9vIN-uAGNBcyGv5giWIO5juzoVMnkKUogq3V3OwelMm4ITtwa-yAogJP4Y6TM242Z9fepzc9Y6l73opbjxzmYr6uvazCx3OOqUFWJVliF4Q-1mC9ezaLXPC4_islnvxchS9lAyjHwRVRdoGJ1RJH-7ULcRnaLmS25ETVcrqM6_EnGd_GmifL0bE6BTf9TzTONlrxaa6aqRwsK5RgDyXmjrT1QSPm7eg89RqzZ9oskVfynhNKe1x8ENVg_FTATLguF69Aw7THk1QASlKM27QUoYzxyz7yKF97GduIkx3J9zynqzi_6dEbQvOJzu7bJdPXadpY/p.jpeg"> Image When: Fri, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Presidential candidate Larry Elder is a New York Times best-selling author, award-winning documentary filmmaker, and talk radio host. In his words, "The welfare state has incentivized women to marry to government and men to abandon their financial and moral responsibility." Larry’s unique style, personal background, and professional experience combine to inspire, inform, and persuade his listeners, readers, and viewers to embrace the timeless American principles of personal responsibility and public accountability. In his words: “The question is not which party has my back, but which party can get government off our backs.” Larry was born and raised in South Central Los Angeles, and his family’s story represents every bit of the American Dream. His father was born in Athens, Georgia, served in the U.S. Marine Corps during World War II, and moved to California to open his own restaurant—Elder’s Snack Bar. Larry’s mother, originally from Huntsville, Alabama, was a clerical worker and raised three boys as a stay-at-home mom. After running for Governor of California in 2021 and securing millions of votes, Larry embarking on the next step in his journey: running for President of the United States. href="http://www.larryelder.com/">More Info

For Whom: Anarchists, Hippies, troublemakers, dissidents, clowns, politicians, and Ron Paul people. summary: How to Opt-Out of a CBDC Dystopia Benjamin Shaffer [Pav]
description: For Whom: Concerned about financial collapse, about massive theft of your wealth, about run-away inflation, about crypto volatility, about free markets? Then come find out how you can opt out of manipulated corporatism and government control of your property! Description: The Feds with either collapse or control your money, either way what are you going to do to preserve as much of your wealth as you can, and still be able to buy bread and water and bullets? Benjamin Shaffer will show you how to get off the sinking ship of the Federal Reserve and their rush toward a Central Bank Digital dystopia. Speaker: Benjamin Shaffer, Benjamin Shaffer is an attorney, and executive for Goldback Inc, the world's largest alternative currency project, and the world's first spendable gold that can be used for everyday transactions. As a student of Austrian Economics he and his colleagues at Goldback are at the forefront of a movement to bring back a truly free market based on sound money. . href="www.Goldback.com"> Website . href="https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/6247af3fd253354ab00d6163/dbac7f6c-ea86-4cc1-bafc-4d21db633d2e/goldback-logo.png?format=1500w"> Image When: Wed, 10:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: I will make it rain Gold at this presentation! want some? be there! href="www.Goldback.com">More Info

A powerhouse vocalist and entertainer, he wrestles the songwriter idiom into joyful and often morbid submission, pairing theatrical facial expressions with soaring melodies. summary: "Jones Plantation" Feature Film Screening Andrew Treglia, Larken Rose [Pav]
description: For Whom: Do you like films? Are you beyond sick of the woke propaganda nonsense you have to endure when watching most films today? "Jones Plantation" is the vanguard film of the new American Dissident Cinema Movement. Description: Through the lens of the Antebellum South, "Jones Plantation", is a mind-altering descent into the devious manipulations of the powerful few who control the masses with ancient dark secrets and hidden schemes. Leader: Andrew Treglia, Producer and Director of "Jones Plantation". href="https://tinyurl.com/24ysy9h9"> Website Speaker: Larken Rose, Screenwriter and Producer of "Jones Plantation" When: Wed, 6:00P (150m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: There will be a meet/greet before the film, and a Q&A after the screening with Larken Rose, and director, Andrew Treglia. href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmiNeyHZqgQTRlvgNpu0XNoC_79DS4ZoS">More Info

summary: Is Deep State Penetrable: Free The People Vivek Ramaswamy, Matt Kibbe, Kyle Seraphin [Pav]
description: For Whom: Deep State haters, police state distrusters, people who don't totally hate voting, presidential election followers, Overton Window shifters, and fans of openness and transparency in political life Description: Think DC reformable? Interested in the 2023 Presidential contest? Curious about Vivek? Matt Kibbe will host a panel interview with Vivek Ramaswamy, Republican candidate for President, and Kyle Seraphin, former FBI agent. They will discuss Kyle's perspective as an ex-Deep Stater and then Vivek's intentions to use exec power to dismantle the Deep State. This event will be broadcast via Matt Kibbe's Free the People show. Speaker: Vivek Ramaswamy, See first page. href="https://www.vivek2024.com/"> Website Moderator: Matt Kibbe, Panelist: Kyle Seraphin, . href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-kyle-seraphin-show/id1654162813"> Website When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: The Free State Project attracts libertarians who wish to separate from the DC overlords because many of us don't believe DC is ever able to be libertated. Vivek disagrees; he promises to remove 75% of the deep state. Can anyone do this? Matt Kibbe will conduct a special Free The People broadcast from the Big Stage of PorcFest to explore the existence, strength, and reformability of the Deep State. He will also ask this candidate about this other libertarian and not-so-libertarian proposals. Your questions can probe deeper. Interviewee: Vivek Ramaswamy, Vivek Ramaswamy is the first millennial to run for the Republican nomination for president. He is an American business leader and the author of books including Woke, Inc.: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam and Capitalist Punishment: How Wall Street is Using Your Money to Create a Country You Didn't Vote For. The media has called him the "intellectual godfathers of the anti-woke movement." Vivek helped identify and popularize discussion of wokeism in mainstream conservative thought. Born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio, Vivek was valedictorian of his high school, went on to graduate summa cum laude in Biology from Harvard and received his J.D. from Yale Law School, while working at a hedge fund. He later started a biotech company, Roivant Sciences, where he oversaw the development of five drugs that went on to become FDA-approved. In 2022, he founded Strive, an Ohio-based asset management firm that directly competes with asset managers like BlackRock, State Street, Vanguard and others, use the money of everyday citizens to advance environmental and social agendas that many citizens and capital owners disagree with. Vivek is married to Apoorva, a throat surgeon and Assistant Professor at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center. They live in Columbus, Ohio where they are raising their two sons. href="https://www.vivek2024.com/">More Info

For Whom: Concerned with arguments that you don't really own "that"? Believe that maybe it would be better if everyone owned everything? Confused as to how things are "distributed"? Description: Authoritarians insist that you do not have full and exclusive use of any property -- their rulers always have a superior ownership right, such that can tax, regulate, and over-rule you. Nonlibertarians don't see a problem with this. . . . What is the ethical derivation for property rights? When is property truly yours and why is it yours? When is it your rulers, or "the people's"? To what extent may you protect your property? Libertarian thought problems on property. Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Writing primarily about libertarian ethics, Dennis became the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora, before he was de-platformed. . . . By then, he had migrated to the Free State. He threw himself into creating communities within the Free State. Dennis founded SWELL, The SHELL liberty community center, the Independence Inn, and the Free State liberty bus tours. He is spearheading the formation of a necklace of liberty community centers throughout the state. . . . Dennis is the NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and was this year's NH Liberty Foum Keynote Speaker. His passion is explaining the beauty of libertarian ethics to anyone who will listen. . . . Dennis also plays as your Chef de Village for PorcFest 2023 (2022, 2021) and has volunteered coordinated PorcFest for the last five years. This is his last year and will be joining you in 2024 as just another attendee.. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Dennis_Pratt-e6842a6532f05875e4f99145c8123f14.png?vsn=d"> Image When: Thu, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: Once you correctly understand how to derive property rights, you will never get confused by socialists'' sophism again. href="https://www.quora.com/Libertarians-What-gives-me-a-right-to-my-property/answer/Dennis-Pratt-3">More Info

For Whom: New to libertarianism? Confused by its different forms? Unclear where you fit? Would like an overview of the different types of libertarians? Think that there is only one type of true libertarian? Come explore the multi-dimensional world of libertarianism -- what we have in common and where we differ. Description: Throughout the campground you'll hear attendees refer to their beliefs using different terms.. What do they mean? What do these terms have in common and how do they differ, and why do the differences matter? . . . Several dimensions distinguish libertarians from one another. This intro class will go through the main dimensions that differentiate libertarians, what the alternative beliefs are, and the rationales behind those beliefs, and what (few things) we can say unifies libertarianism. This should rationalize for you an ethical, cultural, and political movement that can otherwise seem chaotic, especially at a festival like PorcFest, which attracts so many different types of libertarians. Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Writing primarily about libertarian ethics, Dennis became the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora, before he was de-platformed. . . . By then, he had migrated to the Free State. He threw himself into creating communities within the Free State. Dennis is the NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and was this year's NH Liberty Foum Keynote Speaker. His passion is explaining the beauty of libertarian ethics to anyone who will listen. . . . Dennis also plays as your Chef de Village for PorcFest 2023 (2022, 2021) and has volunteered coordinated PorcFest for the last five years. This is his last year and will be joining you in 2024 as just another attendee.. href="https://mobile.twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.fsp.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Voluntaryist-Heart-only.jpg"> Image When: Tue, 3:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: There is a regular presentation each day about libertarianism in the Liberty 101. Take the stairs beside the Arcade. href="https://www.quora.com/Myself-being-a-young-libertarian-could-someone-tell-me-about-anarcho-capitalism-and-compare-it-with-other-branches-of-libertarianism/answer/Dennis-Pratt-3">More Info

summary: Why (Only) NH Is Winning Liberty Dennis Pratt [101]
description: For Whom: If you are unclear why libertarianism has failed in the past and why it seems to be uniquely succeeding in New Hampshire. Description: Libertarianism - the movement to free individuals to become their own person, and not a slave to any ruler - has been often dreamt of, but hardly ever achieved. What have been the main ways that it has tried to be instituted, why have these failed, and what is so different about what the Free State Project is doing in New Hampshire? What challenges and successes are we having here, and how does that bode for the future? And why can only NH follow this path? Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Writing primarily about libertarian ethics, Dennis was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora, before being platformed. . . . By then, he had migrated to the Free State. He threw himself into creating communities within the Free State. Dennis founded SWELL, The SHELL liberty community center, the Independence Inn, and the Free State liberty bus tours. He is spearheading the formation of a necklace of liberty community centers throughout the state. . . . Dennis is the NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and was this year's NH Liberty Foum Keynote Speaker. His passion is explaining the beauty of libertarian ethics - to anyone with the ability to listen. . . . Dennis also plays as your Chef de Village for PorcFest 2023 (2022, 2021) and has volunteered coordinated PorcFest for the last five years. This is his last year and will be joining you in 2024 as just another attendee.. href="https://mobile.twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.fsp.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Voluntaryist-Heart-only.jpg"> Image When: Sat, 1:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: There is a regular presentation each day about the FSP in the Liberty 101. Take the stairs beside the Arcade.

description: For Whom: Are you curious how robust libertarian ethics is? Where are its limitations and strengths? People who want to practice exercising libertarian ethics on the toughest questions. interested in end of life? in the abortion issue? in libertarian ethics? Are you curious how libertarian ethics addresses controversial issues? Description: How does libertarian ethics guide us in tough cases like abortion, suicide and bigotry? We'll look at these big issues through the prism of libertarian ethics, and discuss what is the "libertarian answer", if there is one! Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Writing primarily about libertarian ethics, Dennis became the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora, before he was de-platformed. . . . This is his last year and will be joining you in 2024 as just another attendee.. href="https://mobile.twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.fsp.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Voluntaryist-Heart-only.jpg"> Image When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: There is a regular presentation each day about libertarianism in the Liberty 101. Take the stairs beside the Arcade.

For Whom: People interested in the Free State Project, in Main Stream Media press coverage of libertarianism, and in long-form documentaries of controversial subjects Description: NBC Boston embedded itself with the Free State Project for eight months, including during PorcFest 2022. The result was an eleven episode documentary-series which has enjoyed critical, libertarian, Porcupine, and authoritarian acclaim (not an easy task). "Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of New Hampshire follows a libertarian political migration known as the Free State Project. Twenty years ago, one man penned a manifesto encouraging 20,000 libertarians to sign a pledge and move to the Granite State for more freedom. Now “The Free State Project” is shaking up politics and communities in New Hampshire and growing in strength and numbers." : When: Tue, 6:00P (180m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: The entire eleven episode docu-series will be played on Wed evening at Liberty 101. Three episodes will be repeated Friday 6P at the Pavilion followed by a panel discussion with the producers at 7P. href="https://www.nbcboston.com/news/local/coming-soon-life-liberty-and-the-pursuit-of-new-hampshire/2961708/">More Info

summary: FREE STATE Documentary - Screening of Scene Reinita Susman [101]
description: For Whom: People interested in a new documentary being made about the Free State Project, potential investors, people who love documentaries, lovers of New Hampshire, freedom fighters. Description: Come see a never before seen section of the upcoming documentary, "FREE STATE". Visit freestatedoc.com to view a trailer and donate to the documentary. Speaker: Reinita Susman, Reinita Susman in a documentarian and recent mover to New Hampshire. She produced a documentary in 2021 about lockdowns in southern CA. Her documentary about the Free State is meant as the antidote to the dark and sad story of her previous documentary. . href="freestatedoc.com"> Website When: Thu, 6:00P _(30m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: Please come for a sneak peak! href="freestatedoc.com">More Info

For Whom: Those who are curious at the nuts and bolts of HOW the Free State has become more and more free while the Authoritarian-49 have slipped more and more into tyranny. Those who are ready to help make New Hampshire even more free. Description: The New Hampshire Liberty Alliance is an organization run by volunteers like you, that review almost every bill going through the New Hampshire State House, for its impact on liberty, advises legislators whether bills are pro- or anti- human freedom, and rates NH legislators to let voters know which are trying to free them versus enslave them. If the price of Liberty is eternal vigilance, then NHLA intends to be eternally vigilant! Speaker: Melissa Creem Chair NHLA, Chair of NHLA When: Sat, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://www.nhliberty.org/about/">More Info

summary: Why Porcupines Run as Republicans Ian Underwood [101]
description: For Whom: Liberty folks who want to get involved in the political system, especially in NH. Description: Looking to make changes in the law, but scared of the "Republican" label that many Porcupine legislators use? . . . Learn why even the hardest core libertarians in NH do not -- and should not -- shy away from running as "Republicans". Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. href="https://www.bareminimumbooks.com/"> Website When: Wed, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: A Free Marketeer's Guide to Economic Data Gene Epstein [101]
description: For Whom: Fans of free market economics; liberty lovers & investors who care about the state of the economy & concerns that workers are getting shafted.. Description: Though use of official data, I puncture various myths about the state of the economy (like what caused the price inflation). Speaker: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. . href="https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58ac6b92414fb5aa5de25b89/1540759502298-Z8YOG2CTZ4PMJF87R4DR/HeadShot_Square.jpg?format=1000w"> Image When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: Free State Food Network: Securing Our Own Food Stephen Nass [101]
description: For Whom: People interested in eating food, even when the masses are starving Description: We're pushing back on government interference in New Hampshire, but in the food industry we have a long way to go. We all saw how in 2020 the state shut down businesses and tasked them with arbitrary rules and fines. For restaurants and food producers this level of bureaucracy is nothing new. Learn how we can team up to help free our farmers, chefs and food professionals in our Free State quest for liberty. Speaker: Stephen Nass, Restaurant owner, chef, and one of the founders behind the Shell community center.. href="freestatefood.net"> Website . href="https://freestatefood.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/cropped-Copy-of-FSFN-Logo.png"> Image When: Wed, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://freestatefood.net/">More Info

summary: The SHELL: A Liberty Community Center Stephen, Scott [101]
description: For Whom: People who feel that liberty is lonely, because in the Free State, it ain't. Description: The SHELL opened right as CoVid lockdown happened -- two weeks later 70 Free Staters were attending a Robbie The Fire comedy night. It has become the Free State's premiere liberty clubhouse, with more events than all the other clubhouses combined. . . . We'll describe The SHELL, its history, its importance to the Free State, and how it, and other Free State liberty clubhouses like it, are a key reason why you should be moving here. : Stephen : Scott, When: Thu, 12:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="shellnh.org">More Info

summary: Defend the Guard: Uphold the Constitution Derek Proux [101]
description:
For Whom: Military. Anti-War. Free Staters. People concerned with overbearing Federal Government being able to bully states. How to nullify Fed gov.

Description: What can a Free State do to impede an overbearing Federal Government? Nullification.
. . . Defend the Guard is the just one example of the type of nullification that we would execute to stop government over-reach -- in this case, the warfare state.
. . . Defend the Guard says that the state will not contribute its National Guard to undeclared overseas. Learn the history, current status, and prospects of this historic nullification.
Speaker: Derek Proux
When: Fri, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: A Not-So-Brief History of the Free State Carla Gericke [101]
description: For Whom: People new to the Free State, or who don't know how we got here. Description: Dirty laundry, you say? Who has better behind-the-scenes scoops than Queen Quill herself? Between major milestones and major dramas, the story of the Free State Project is a story of human action, and how a group of tireless volunteers took a quaint idea and turned it into the world's most historic movement for freedom in the world today. Speaker: Carla Gericke, Carla is an early mover and OG, taking executive and volunteer roles within the FSP since 2008, as well as leading efforts to make New Hampshire more free by serving on boards and running for office. Carla is affectionately known as ‘Queen Quill’, is the Chair of the Free State Project, lead producer of numerous PorcFests, and constant volunteer. She spearheads innumerable liberty efforts in the Free State, including issues relating to 1st, 2nd, 4th and 10th Amendment issues, government accountability/transparency, and how to Live Free and Thrive!. href="https://www.carlagericke.com/"> Website When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://www.carlagericke.com/">More Info

summary: Zoning and the Housing Crisis Jason Sorens [101]
description:
For Whom: People interested in the housing market, anyone interested in local government, anyone who wants to help NH rise in the freedom rankings
Description: How are zoning regulations causing a scarcity of housing in much of the country? Could the free market provide affordable housing to all? What are the alternatives to zoning, and should we try to abolish zoning completely?
Speaker: Jason Sorens
When: Thu, 10:00A _(60m)
Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

For Whom: This is an introductory session for attendees interesting the ideas associated withal a free and prosperous society.

Speaker: Ryan Yonk, Libertarian economist affiliated with AIER
When: Tue, 4:00P _(60m)
Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: FDR's New Deal Reset Robert E. Wright [101]
description: For Whom: Anyone who wants to rid themselves of the notion that FDR and the New Deal did anything to help revive the national economy or help even the most vulnerable Americans. Description: 2023 is the 90th anniversary of the New Deal put in place by "that man in the White House." The standard story taught in government schools is akin to Soviet disinformation. Come to this session to learn the REAL DEAL about the New Deal, America's first Great Reset. Speaker: Robert E. Wright, Wright is a published lyricist (Independent Review) as well as the author of Liberty Lost (AIER 2023) and 23 other liberty rockin' books.. href="https://www.aier.org/people/robert-e-wright/"> Website . href="https://www.aier.org/wp-content/webpc-passthru.php?src=https://www.aier.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/Robert-E-Wright.jpg&nocache=1"> Image When: Wed, 10:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: Bob promises a raucous rant grounded in his forthcoming book, FDR's Great Reset. href="https://www.aier.org/article/fdrs-raw-deal-for-african-americans/">More Info

summary: ESG on the Chopping Block Pete Earle [101]
description: For Whom: Lovers of liberty, innovation, and free markets disturbed by the infection of corporate America by wokism. Description: A look at some of the current moves being made against the spread of ESG in the corporate world. (Hint: We're winning!) Speaker: Pete Earle, Economist who spent over 20 years in financial markets. href="https://www.aier.org/people/peter-c-earle/"> Website . href="https://www.aier.org/people/peter-c-earle/"> Image When: Fri, 10:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: How to legally stop paying income tax. Dan Taxation Is Theft Behrman [101]
description: For Whom: If you even mildly dislike taxes. If you love taxes and believe "It's the price we voluntarily pay for society." Description: Dan Taxation Is Theft Behrman has toured the country as part of multiple presidential campaigns with his message, and he will explain why taxation is theft, how the IRS works, and how millions of people are legally avoiding the income tax. Speaker: Dan Taxation Is Theft Behrman. href="https://TaxationIsTheft.info"> Website . href="https://taxationistheft.info/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dan-behrman-for-governor-of-texas_540x.jpg"> Image When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://taxationistheft.info">More Info

summary: 10 Progressive Lies About Economics Keith Knight [101]
description: For Whom: Anyone interested in combatting the statist claims of academics. Description: Progressive ideas are dominant in academia, the press, Hollywood, human resource departments, and in the everyday assumptions of voters. Their confidence in promoting these ideas comes from their complete ignorance regarding the study of the use of scarce resources which have alternative uses. I will go through 10 examples of why the deadly religion of Progressivism should be relentlessly mocked. Speaker: Keith Knight, My primary motive for starting my podcast was to give people access to a free alternative to college education regarding history, economics, politics, and philosophy. . href="https://libertarianinstitute.org/author/keith-knight/"> Website When: Fri, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://libertarianinstitute.org/author/keith-knight/">More Info

For Whom: Activists, medical freedom, anti-covid fascism, reducing bureaucracy Description: A 101 on the grassroots organization RebuildNH. How they began opposing Covid tyranny and evolved. Speaker: Melissa Balsek, Executive Director RebuildNH. href="www.rebuildnh.com"> Website When: Fri, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="www.rebuildnh.com">More Info

For Whom: People who would like to understand economics. Also people who think they do understand economics but cannot see why anyone would want to. Description: Economics is a way of understanding human behavior relevant not only to issues such as inflation and unemployment but also war, marriage, politics and much else. It is of particular interest to libertarians because it provides the tools to understand how large numbers of individuals can coordinate their activities with nobody at the top telling everyone else what to do. Speaker: David Friedman, An American economist, legal scholar, and anarcho-capitalist theorist, author of six non-fiction books, many articles and three novels. His most popular book is The Machinery of Freedom: Guide to a Radical Capitalism. href="www.daviddfriedman.com"> Website When: Sat, 12:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="http://www.daviddfriedman.com/Ideas%20I/Economics/Making%20Economics%20Fun.pdf">More Info

summary: Escaping the Most Dangerous Superstition Larken Rose [101]
description: For Whom: This talk is especially for all those people who are not yet familiar with my work, or what my main "theme" is in almost everything I do. Description: Many millions of people desperately want to make the world a better place, while unaware of the fact that they themselves are unwitting "carriers" and "spreaders" of the primary obstacle to peace, prosperity, and human progress. Good intentions are not enough, among people whose thinking is still warped and twisted by an anti-human superstition. And, unfortunately, that describes the majority of the world's population. summary: A Free State Project in your state or country? Mark Vandermaas, Founder, NBFP (nbfree.ca), Derek Proux, Dennis Pratt [101]
description: For Whom: Canadians. Foreigners from other countries who cannot immigrate. Americans from other states who would rather not migrate to New Hampshire. Prospects for liberty in more than one location. Description: Wouldn't you love to create a Free State Project in your state? In your country? Right next door. Wouldn't have to move. . . . Our Canadian friends have languished in Canada without the ability to legally escape to New Hampshire, so they have done just that. The founder of the New Brunswick FreeProvince Project...modelled on our own movement...will talk about his reasons and plans for their liberty project, as well as their gratitude for help from Free Staters. The Chef will talk about the prospects of other "Free State Project" efforts. Panelist: Mark Vandermaas, Founder, NBFP (nbfree.ca), Mark Vandermaas is a former Canadian soldier and United Nations peacekeeper who founded the New Brunswick FreeProvince Project (nbfree.ca) in 2021 after witnessing the human rights abuses associated with Covid. The mission and strategy of the NBFP was inspired by the NHFSP: liberate Canadians from socialist oppression by concentrating freedom-lovers in a sparsely-populated (800K) province. In 2023, the NBFP became the first and only Canadian freedom project to be listed in the Free Cities Foundation's directory of 'Free Communities' (free-communities.org). Prior to Covid, Mark had many years of experience as a rule of law activist defending Canada's Charter of Rights against abuses by police, government, media, leftist radicals and violent Native militants during a fraudulent land claim dispute in Caledonia, Ontario. He was part of a team whose work led to a 9-0 victory at the Supreme Court of Canada that defined the limits of police/government infringement of the constitution during an 'emergency.' Mark's work is cited in two books about the Caledonia crisis: the bestseller, 'Helpless: Caledonia's Nightmare of Fear And Anarchy, And How The Law Failed All Of Us,' and the near-best-seller, 'Victory In The No-Go Zone: Winning The Fight Against Two-Tier Policing.' In September 2021, Mark released a prescient report outlining in detail the concerns about the mRNA 'vaccines' and the devastating consequences to society of using coercion to force them on citizens: 'Vaccine Hesitancy And The Risks Of Medical Segregation Discrimination Policies.' It can be downloaded at nbfree.ca/number downloads. . href="https://www.nbfree.ca/"> Website . href="https://custom-images.strikinglycdn.com/res/hrscywv4p/image/upload/c_limit,fl_lossy,h_9000,w_1200,f_auto,q_auto/445259/274038_155182.png"> Image Moderator: Derek Proux, Panelist: Dennis Pratt, Designer of current series of PorcFests, Chef de Village of last three PorcFests, founder of SHELL, Swell, Independence Inn, Free State Tours, 42 years arguing for liberty, 4.5 years in New Hampshire and major shill for focusing our energies on creating one Libertarian Homeland. Keith twice had the second highest monthly COS petition signing count in the 50 states through his activism. He has now given up working toward an Article V convention and has a few thoughts on the strategy. Professionally, Keith is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications systems for military aircraft, ships, and submarines. summary: Die Free: Free State Assisted Suicide Conner Drigotas [101]
description: For Whom: Concerned about your own end of life - that you won't be able to control when and how you die, and how much pain and expense and time it takes? Under current law, government officials claim power to prevent you from accessing compassionate care, limiting your right to your own body. Libertarianism rests on self-ownership. Logically your most intimate decision - when to end your body's existence - should be yours alone to make. The state abrogates self-ownership and in some cases, condemns people to painful, prolonged draining death when humane alternatives exist. summary: Bank Run Now: Halt CBDC, Stop WW3, End the Fed Aaron Day [101]
description: For Whom: Anyone concerned about the collapse US dollar/banking system, interested in the breathtaking speed of the global rollout of CBDCs and the surveillance state who wants to take control of their own financial sovereignty and halt the spread of global tyranny without having to rely on corrupt politicians or the ballot box. Also, anyone interested in self-custody crypto, gold, and silver. The United States dollar is collapsing (like all fiat currencies before it) and there is a coordinated effort to usher in Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) which is a gateway to digital tyranny (social credit scores, vaccines passports, etc.). The technology has already been developed and tested in the US and by the end of this year over 1 billion people globally will be using censorable, government-controlled digital currency. Congress will never vote to reduce their power or monopoly control over money. Free stater, early mover, author and 2024 Presidential Candidate [R] explains how we can halt CBDC, stop World War 3, and End the Fed by participating in a Bank Run Now (exiting failing fiat for self-custody crypto, gold, and silver.) Description: Worried about the collapse of the dollar and the US banking system? Want to learn more about the fast rollout of the globalist strategy to implement Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) as the basis for a completely digital tyranny? This talk discusses the immediate threats, discusses the futility of the political process to stop it, and describes how through a bank run and move out of fiat into self-custody crypto, gold, and silver we can stop this. We may have less than 12 months. Speaker: Aaron Day, Early FSP Mover (2009), Former Chair of the FSP, ran multiple pro-liberty political organizations and think tanks. 2016 Candidate for US Senate. 2024 Presidential Candidate [R], first Bitcoin in 2012, living off of crypto exclusively since 2019. Author of recently published book on this topic The Final Countdown: Crypto, Gold, Silver, and the People’s Last Stand Against Tyranny by Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). href="http://www.day2024.com"> Website When: Sat, 5:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office href="https://day2024.com/the-final-countdown-crypto-gold-silver-and-the-peoples-last-stand-against-tyranny-by-central-bank-digital-currencies-cbdcs/">More Info

If you are a coordinator of PF2022 Description: All volunteers of PorcFest XX 2023 gather together to appreciate the work we have done, and the gift we are about to bestow on three thousand liberty lovers yearning for freedom. Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) . . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. . . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Dennis_Pratt-e6842a6532f05875e4f99145c8123f14.png"> Image When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula Note: We will have a meeting of all volunteers each day at 9A at the Free State Live stage. summary: PorcFest Volunteer Gathering Constance Spencer, Dennis Pratt [FSP]
description: For Whom: PF volunteers, or those who want to help PF Find out what happened yesterday and what's coming up today. Facilities, PorcRangers, Fr33 Aid, Pavillion, Liberty 101, Pints, Registration, etc. Description: If you're volunteering at PorcFest -- or want to volunteer at PorcFest -- come to our daily meetup to get the inside scoop on what's happening, and to coordinate with your coordinators. Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) . . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. . . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. href="https://www.independencerealtynh.com"> Website . href="https://www.amazon.com/photos/shared/nX5q1bAmRd-wZXaAjuXMOA.4R627B63-BjOzf19edUvRR"> Image Chef de Village, PorcFest XX 2023: Dennis Pratt, This is Dennis' fifth and final year volunteering to coordinate PorcFest, and his third year as co-producer/"Chef de Village". He is in charge of positioning, events, hubs, speakers, sponsors, marketing, and revenues. . . . Dennis reimagined PorcFest in 2020 to align more with our FSP goals to attract liberty lovers to the Free State, and to connect and activate those liberty lovers to build greater liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.nhlibertyforum.com/images/speakers/Dennis_Pratt-e6842a6532f05875e4f99145c8123f14.png"> Image When: Wed, 9:00A _(30m) Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula
