For Whom: If you live in, once lived in, or have moved from Upper New York, Vermont, Maine, or Canada
Description: Come meet others currently living or from Vermont, Maine, NY, and Canada. You traveled far to get here and so did they!  
 . . Find out where they live. Look for someone who live(d) close to you. What liberty events they do/did there. What events are you looking forward to this week? Make plans to meet again at another event, and perhaps when you get back home.”
: Dennis Pratt, Redesigner and Chef de Village of PF 2023, 2022, 2021. Founder of The SHELL, Independence Inn, Free State Tours. blah blah blah Lived in NYC, NJ, Chgo, Boulder, Boston. MIT blah blah blah. Moved 4.5 years ago blah blah blah
When: Wed, 10:30A _(30m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula
Note: We'll have US regional meetings Wed morning -> early afternoon. If you've lived in multiple states, consider coming to several of the meetups to meet liberty lovers from your old states.

summary: AMA with Jason Sorens & Mark Warden Mrs Kin [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project Description: As a graduate student Jason Sorens wrote the article about libertarian concentration that sparked a movement called the Free State Project. Mark Warden was an early mover and through Porcupine Real Estate has helped many others follow him. Now they are both serving on the FSP board. Come with your questions!! Moderator: Mrs Kin. href="https://www.cato.org/sites/cato.org/files/styles/bio_picture_desktop_3x/public/authors/crops/barcelona-cropped.jpg?itok=i_9t4HC2"> Image When: Wed, 2:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

For Whom: Free State Live Podcast Listeners Description: Join Justin, Carla, Jeremy, Kevin, and Bill live from PorcFest for their weekly roundup on what's going on with The Free State Project in the Live Free or Die state of New Hampshire! Panelist: Justin O'Donnell When: Fri, 4:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula href="https://www.youtube.com/@FreeStateProjectNH/podcasts">More Info

summary: AMA with Carolann Fenton & Seamus Casey Mrs.Kin [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project Description: Seamus Casey developed GenCourt mobile, an essential tool for local political activists, and continues to actively encourage movers to take part in NH state politics. Meanwhile, Carolann Fenton has been making waves in crypto investment circles as managing Director and COO at Chainstone Labs, Project Manager of Watchdog Capital, and co-host on Satoshi Roundtable. Now they are both serving on the FSP board. Come with your questions!! Moderator: Mrs.Kin When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula href="https://fsp.org">More Info

For Whom:  Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project
Description: A founder of LBRY and Odysee, former Executive Director of the Free State Project and recent LP senate candidate, Jeremy Kauffman uses innovative technology and attention-grabbing social media to raise the profile of New Hampshire as a libertarian homeland. Currently, Jeremy is a serving member of the FSP board and leader of our Comms Team volunteers. Come with your questions!!
Moderator: Mrs.Kin
When: Fri, 2:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

For Whom:  Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project
Description: Carla Gericke, "Queen Quill," is the primary spokesperson for Free State Project. Currently chairwoman of the board, she is also a former FSP executive director and PorcFest Organizer. Carla is open about her personal story of immigration to U.S. from South Africa, transforming her health and well-being through diet, and connecting with libertarian activists and neighbors here in the Free State. Come with your questions!!
Moderator: Mrs.Kin
When: Fri, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

summary: Coffee with a Coordinator: Constance Spencer Constance Spencer [FSP]
description:
For Whom: Visitors and newcomers curious about the "behind the scenes" of coordinating PorcFest and the amazing volunteers who run it.
Description: Constance Spencer shares her mover story "From Woe to Wow"
Speaker: Constance Spencer
When: Fri, 10:00A _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

summary: Coffee with a Coordinator: Dennis Pratt Dennis Pratt [FSP]
description: For Whom: Entrepreneurs curious about creating bigger/better. Attendees curious about the "behind the scenes" of design decisions and difficult implementations of PorcFest Description: Dennis Pratt shares his experiences moving to the Free State, exploring and failing w/ various groups, finding his place by volunteering at PorcFest, and redesigning the festival. He'll talk about the marketing principles he applied to double its attendance, and the libertarian principles to multiply its events by seven, using it to emphasize the role of entrepreneur to spur markets. Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest, NH's Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. 42 years a libertarian, he was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before being deplatformed. He moved to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer to build our Libertarian Homeland, starting the famous SHELL libertarian clubhouse, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the nefarious LPNH, and tweeting about libertarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks at Liberty 101 on libertarianism. His background is new product design in emerging industries, MIT and Northwestern, and 42 years married to wife Carol. He has daughter Vivian and dog Ron Paw.. href="https://twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://porcfest.com/schedule/"> Image When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

For Whom: Doers, not spectators Description: Did you know PorcFest is run by volunteers? Come join the team! We'll have shift-sign ups available for Registration, PorcInfo, Fr33Aid, PorcRangers, Facilities, Pavillion, and Liberty 101. Bring your festival experience to the next level by pitching in for a couple of hours. Be a part of PorcFestXX! PorcFest is for doers. Come and build our libertarian homeland. Organizer: Mrs.Kin When: Mon, 3:00P _(30m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula href="https://porcfest.com/volunteer">More Info

For Whom: Free Staters
Description: Drop by to add your work or a note of gratitude for another's efforts on our giant mindmap of the FSP within the Free State movement. 

Through the FSP thousands of people have committed to exert their fullest practical effort toward the creation of a society in which the maximum role of civil government is the protection of individuals' life, liberty, and property. Come see what they've been up to and add your own effort to the mind map!

summary: What the FSP? - Welcome home! Tim Bauman, Patrick Binder, Jack Garber, Calvin Beaulier [FSP]
description:
For Whom: New movers or those planning their move to NH
Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others....

Welcome home! Potlucks & local connections 

After you move to New Hampshire, you'll be encouraged by the FSP Moving Director Chris Lopez, your friends online, and your new neighbors to go to a new mover potluck or a local liberty meetup. Who runs these events? Who and what are they for? Come find out more as we discuss the emergent order of potlucks and how to build local connections with event hosts from across the state.
Panelist: Tim Bauman, Host of Ossipee Porcupines Meetup
Panelist: Patrick Binder, Manchester New Mover Potluck MC, former host of Manchester Market Day
Panelist: Jack Garber, Host of SHELL New Mover Brunch
Panelist: Calvin Beaulier, Occasional host of North Country Porcupines Potluck
When: Tue, 5:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula
Note: Find liberty events in your region of NH on fsp.org/calendar

summary: What the FSP? - FOMO on the Freedom Jeremy Kauffman, Ron Rule, Josh Elbahrawy [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors and newcomers Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others.... FOMO on the Freedom: Social media & monthly newsletter Join Jeremy Kauffman and FSP Comms volunteers the get the inside scoop of how they use different social media platforms to boost messaging that makes New Hampshire more appealing to libertarians (and less appealing to progressive statists) Panelist: Jeremy Kauffman, FSP board member and Comms Team Lead Panelist: Ron Rule, FSP Twitter Volunteer Panelist: Josh Elbahrawy, Newsletter volunteer When: Fri, 5:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula href="https://fsp.org/connect">More Info

For Whom: Visitors and newcomers Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others.... Attracting "doers" : Liberty Forum and PorcFest A longtime volunteer at both PorcFest and Liberty Forum, Mickey Mullin stepped up as organizer of Liberty Forum 2023 and brought together a program that emphasized the work of local activists and thought leaders in: politics and secession, crypto and personal privacy, homeschooling and homesteading. Come hear an insider perspective on the role FSP events have to play in attracting liberty activists to New Hampshire. Speaker: Mickey Mullin When: Thu, 5:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula href="https://nhlibertyforum.com">More Info

summary: What the FSP? - Making the Move Chris Lopez [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors, newcomers, and anyone planning their move to the Free State Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others.... Making the Move: Calling Parties & Welcome Wagons Once a month, FSP volunteers gather to call people who are planning their move to answer their questions and help them find resources. Once they are on their way, these new Free Staters contact Chris to schedule a Welcome Wagon where more volunteers show up on their doorstep to unload their moving truck. Come find out about the work Chris Lopez does behind the scenes to make this magic happen and hear some of her favorite mover stories. Speaker: Chris Lopez, Moving Director, Free State Project When: Wed, 5:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula Note: Request a call during our next calling party at fsp.org/callme href="https://fsp.org/welcome">More Info

summary: What the FSP? - An Organization & a Movement Mrs.Kin [FSP]
description:
For Whom: Visitors, newcomers, and recent movers looking to get involved
Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others.... 

An Organization & a Movement 

Did you know that the Free State Project is an educational & community building charity? As a 501c3 donations are tax deductible but board members, staff, and volunteers have to be careful not to endorse political candidates or upcoming legislation. 
So what's the news coverage about Free Staters running (& winning) in New Hampshire politics talking about? 
Come learn more about the Free State Project, what it means to be a Free Stater, & how you can increase liberty in our lifetime.
Facilitator: Mrs.Kin, In-State Operations Director, Free State Project
When: Sat, 5:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula
Note: To make sure your efforts are recognized in this discussion, stop by during the week to add your liberty organization to our giant mind map of the Free State Movement.  
"What's Your Fullest Practical Effort?" 4 PM Mon, Wed, & Thur @ [FSP]

summary: State vs. federal Citizenship: Choices Christopher Gronski [PINT]
description: For Whom: Parents who want to learn more about state vs federal citizenship and choices you can be making for your family Description: Is your child (or you) a state or federal citizen? Most people do not even know they have a choice. Come hear about the choices you have for your family and imagine how much you could invest in your family's future if you did not have to pay an income tax to the podophiles in the District of Columbia? Speaker: Christopher Gronski, Living in New Hampshire since 1987, Christopher has a great concern for America as he sees the local, state and federal governments disregard the Rights of the People worldwide. . . . New Hampshire’s state motto “Live Free or Die”, declares his sentiment and commitment to the Freedom movement here in America. . . . Christopher Gronski – Freedom Biography . . . Living in New Hampshire since 1987, Christopher Gronski has been studying Federal jurisdiction and tax laws for over 20 years and has been a Freedom Consultant for many Freedom minded people from around the country and world. . . . Christopher was the New Hampshire State Coordinator for We The People (www.givemeliberty.org) for over 10 years and is New Hampshire’s current President of Freedom Force International. (www.freedom–force.org). He has been an active in supporting the Free State Project (www.freestateproject.org) since its inception and has been a guest speaker at FSP’s PorcFest and Liberty Forum. . . . Christopher was a Selectman (Town Council) for the Town of Hill, New Hampshire. He has worked with New Hampshire State Representatives to write and pass laws that restrict government and protect Rights. He successfully works with the U.S. State Department in acquiring United States Passports for State Citizens, without being U.S. (federal, 14th Amendment) citizens. His State Citizenship work has includes the New Hampshire State Department, Department of Transportation and New Hampshire Superior Court. . . . Christopher teaches State Citizenship Classes Online and helps people eliminate various forms of debt, including dealing with the IRS and setting up Foreign Trust Organizations. . . . Christopher is happily married and has two adult children.. href="https://destinationfreedom.org/"> Website When: Thu, 2:00P _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

summary: Pop Up Adventure Playground (sheet painting) Moira, StephAnie Buzzell [PINT]
description: For Whom: Children Description: Pop up Playground! Add your paint "signature" to the sheet to kick off the PorcuPint Pop up playground. All ages welcome for sheet painting. Pop up playground will be available all week for ages birth-6. Location and times tbd, Pop Up style! Ask at toddler-K morning meet up or at PorcuPints daily for location. See link for more info: https://youtu.be/Vc9nBmxQ8r4 : Moira, Moira’s decision to become a mother was a pivotal moment in her life and because of this, in the spring of 2016, she began to develop the concept of a new business model to support childhood learning. This idea was born out of Moira’s desire to help other parents on their journey out of what currently passes for "education" and into something that empowered children to take leadership in their own learning process. By 2017, as a free local initiative, Moira started “Albany Pop-Up Adventure Playground” - a temporary play space filled with loose parts and objects designed to inspire imagination and creativity. By the time of the lockdowns, more than 700 people had attended the pop-ups, which Moira designed in her own local community as an opportunity for all children to have access to child-led play.. href="https://linktr.ee/thelearningweb"> Website : StephAnie Buzzell, When: Tue, 10:00A (120m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo href="https://youtu.be/Vc9nBmxQ8r4">More Info

description:
For Whom: Anyone who wants to learn juggling!
Description: Informal, drop-in anytime: Learn to Juggle with scarves (great for beginners because it slows down gravity). Scarves provided. If your kid will be super into this, you might like to bring three juggling-friendly beanbags (preferred for the novice because they don't bounce all over when dropped. There are various tutorials online to make your own. You can also purchase them pretty inexpensively. If you have a kid that already knows how to juggle and wants to learn slightly more advanced stuff, like passing with another juggler, I'm happy to help with that, too (but it might have to be after the main "session").  Finally, if you have a kid that can juggle five, maybe they can teach me. 🙂

description: For Whom: Porcupint kids and teens Description: Did someone catch you being a cool porcupint? Did you add your tickets to the prize bucket you desire (with your NAME and CAMP SITE number )? Come to the raffle drawing to see if you won your dream prize or a glow stick to bring down to the main field for the burning porcupine ceremony. A big THANKS to all the cool porcupints who contributed to a kind, helpful PorcFest! : StephAnie Buzzell : Lauren Noone, A voluntary society thrives with a good dose of kindness. Thank you Rooted Free for the Catch Kindness (for adults/teens) and Caught You Being Cool (for kids/teens) campaign to help inspire a community rooted in kindness! When: Sat, 12:30P _(30m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13rAfpQznZPcHRWDZ0-SmjQ4lSZ0l4dbL/view?usp=sharing">More Info

summary: Caught You Being Cool! StephAnie Buzzell, Lauren Noone [PINT]
description: For Whom: PorcuPints children and teens Description: Can we catch you being a cool porcupine? A voluntary society thrives on kindness. Throughout the week you might be caught being cool, and given a raffle ticket when you are! Any behavior that's becoming of a porcupine may earn you raffle tickets. (examples: being kind to someone, resolving conflict peacefully, helping another kid, picking up trash, cleaning up at Pints, etc.) Add your tickets to the raffle boxes at PorcuPints. Then come by on Saturday for the final drawing. Be sure to write your NAME and SITE number on each ticket so we can let you know if you win! : StephAnie Buzzell : Lauren Noone, A voluntary society thrives with a good dose of kindness. Thank you Rooted Free for the Catch Kindness (for adults/teens) and Caught You Being Cool (for kids/teens) campaign to help inspire a community rooted in kindness! summary: Are You a Family with Kids/Teens at PF? Read This! StephAnie Buzzell [PINT]
description: For Whom: Families, Kids, Teens Description: There's something for everyone in the family! PorcuPints and PorcuTeens will be available all week with activities, crafts, games, and even talks for parents/families. General hours for PorcuPints 9a-10:30p and PorcuTeens 10a-?? Do teens ever sleep??? Please read more info link for info on free range kids, PorcuPint/Teen schedule, what to pack, food at Pints, cost, and more. If you have any questions, please join the telegram group (in link). Here's to a fun-filled week! https://drive.google.com/file/d/13rAfpQznZPcHRWDZ0-SmjQ4lSZ0l4dbL/view?usp=sharing : StephAnie Buzzell, As the PorcuPints 2023 coordinator, I am SO GRATEFUL to all of the volunteers who filled the Pints schedule with activities, talks, and ideas! This is my family's 6th PorcFest and I'm especially excited to celebrate PFXX with all of you! During the year I strive to create a space where children are free to grow and learn through natural curiosity in a respectful, loving environment and parents feel connected, equipped, and empowered wherever they are on their parenting journey. Originally in MA, Anie’s Hive reopened in NH when our family made the move in 2021. Anie's Hive offers homeschool enrichment opportunities, parenting resources, workshops and consultations to journey with other families focused on raising a future generation of independent, free-thinking, compassionate humans. It is my hope that PFXX empowers your family to live free and thrive! StephAnie: 802-289-0926 When: Mon, 6:30A _(30m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13rAfpQznZPcHRWDZ0-SmjQ4lSZ0l4dbL/view?usp=sharing">More Info

summary: Investing in our Posterity Series Jay Noone [PINT]
description:
For Whom: 
Description: Stop letting the algorithm and government schools raise your kids!  Parents- come learn to prepare the next generation to have the confidence and competence to not need government.
: Jay Noone, 
Bourne in ‘79 on western Massachusetts, the oldest of six kids.   Jay was raised by an  O.G. libertarian horse trader, Spud Noone.   Jay spent his youth going to horse auctions, livestock auctions, horse shows and rodeos.    Jay also attended many freedom meetings and law study groups like one put on By the John Birch society.    As a teenager Jay worked or apprenticed in many trades that include, HVAC, logging, auto and equipment repair, roofing, welding, blacksmithing, farrier, feed broker, hay stacker and all around farm hand.     Jay was a hay dealer and horse trader until 2013, then he moved to Colorado to work on a 3500 acre crop farm, a large commercial dairy operation, and a harvest crew, that was Owned buy his Mom Karen and Stepfather Trent.

Then he moved to New Hampshire in late 2016 to join the FreeStateproject.org.  Jay met his wife Shalon at the Porcupine Freedom Festival (Porcfest) in 2014, they got Married at Porcfest in 2018 bought a home with some land, has 2 kids and started raising cows, pigs and chickens and preparing generation next to not need government.   Jay Started a home school event called ManCamp, to build confidence in children by teaching them real life skills like welding, blacksmithing, farming, ranching, problem solving, patience, tolerance, and most importantly encouraging kids to earn there dopamine hits from farm work.

Jay is a long time advocate of trading out side of fiat money, buy using barter, Bitcoin, silver, and gold-backs.   A long time co host on Free Talk live, and has made many appearances on declare your Independence with Ernest Handcock.

Jay is Currently developing a series of lectures, titled "Invest In Our Posterity" as he feels people are just letting the algorithm and government schools raise their kids.  The work he is doing now is preparing generation next to have the confidence and competence to not need government, and teaching parents how to build confidence in their children.

Podcast and live radio shows Jay has appeared on

A recent episode with Erine Handcock

 https://www.freedomsphoenix.com/Media/343613-2023-05-10-2023-05-11-ernest-hancock-interviews-jay-noone-prepping-raising.htm

Recent episode of Free talk Live i was on https://odysee.com/@FreeTalkLive:d/2023-06-01:7

Podcast with Tim Picciott the Liberty Advisor https://muse.ai/vt/p5HPaXb-jay-noone-dcys

When: Mon, 7:00P _(60m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo
Note: Discussion is at the bingo hall near the playground. Pint/Hive on map.

summary: Social media influencer: Start your side hustle Michelle Rountree [PINT]
description:
For Whom: 
Description: I have been a mommy/homeschool influencer for over a year, and have had moderate success without much work. Depending on your niche and how much drive you have, you can make really good money. Come listen to my short talk and then I'll open the floor for questioning and if time allows I could look at your online presence and offer  suggestions. My talk will also include quality of life issues and autonomy of children and online threats.
: Michelle Rountree
When: Fri, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

summary: Kids Read, Parents Listen: A Story Hour Olga Sorens [PINT]
description:
For Whom: Porcupints 12 and under and their parents and anyone who wants to supportively listen to our porcupints read
Description: A special story hour featuring our very own porcupints! Our kids are awesome readers! Listen to them share their favorite stories and creative writing, and put the emphasis back on learning, leading and inspiring. Kids can bring a book they like or have written. They will be welcome to read a part of it to an audience of parents. 

Green eggs and ham will be served! 
(If you’d like, please bring a “picnic breakfast” to eat with your family while you listen to the stories!)
Host: Olga Sorens, Proud Porcumom
When: Sat, 9:00A (120m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo
Note: Don’t forget to pack your favorite book or written story and bring it with you to the event!

: Aurora
: Corinn,

When: Fri, 7:00P _(90m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

For Whom: Attendees of the historic, largest ever, most baed PorcFest XX 2023!
Description: The closing of the official  festival takes place with the Burning of the Porcupine. Come, share a light, say farewell to the festival, talk with your fellow porcupines about how you can advance liberty in your lifetime -- outside of PorcFest… 
…and prepare for the night.


When: Sat, 8:30P _(90m)

Where: Field: Field, Field

More Info: https://freemarketanarchist.files.wordpress.com/2008/06/burning_porc1.jpg?w=444&h=598
Chef de Village: Dennis Pratt, One of your principal guides over the last five years, our Chef de Village Dennis is hanging up his official leadership with XX.  Give him a big hug!
Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023.  Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.)
. . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty.
. . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools.
. . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty.
. . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.
When: Sat, 8:30P (100m)
Where: FLD: Field, Field

summary: Photo Shoot: Official PorcFest XX Group Photo Constance Spencer [FLD]
description:
For Whom: Every PorcFest attendee of 2023 -- old and young; newbie and old-timer,' sober or not; politicos, agorists, ancaps, beltways, preppers, curious, spouses; Christians, Jews, Muslims, atheists; speakers and listeners; campers and hotelers; 
. . . The only people who should not be down in the field for this photo are Feds.

Description: Attention! Attention! All attendees gather on the field for our annual group photo, so that we can tell the world there exists a small group - which is far larger than they think - of freedom lovers willing to travel -- and some even migrate -- to create Liberty in our Lifetime. 
Director of Operations: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023.  Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.)
. . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty.
. . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools.
. . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty.
. . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.
When: Sat, 2:30P _(30m)
Where: FLD: Field, Field
Note: This photo shares with the world the number and type of attendees. It is the culmination of our festival. If you don't like your photo taken, turn backwards, or wear a disguise. But please do attend to show the world how many there are of us who really don't like the State and are willing to explore migrating to create on small region for Liberty In Our Lifetime.
. . . NO FEDS though.

For Whom: Everyone who has attended this PorcFest: Vendor and vendee; hub organizers and hub attendees; speakers and listeners; families and singles. Description: Find and gather your campsite, your hubs, your friends, your associates all together and make your way down to the field for our annual photo. Bring symbols of your clan -- matching t-shirts, banners, signs, etc. And surround yourself with your clan and your friends for our annual PorcFest (XX) photoshoot. . . . Themes of similar shirts, hats, colors etc are always good. Banners, signs, etc. Chef de Village: Dennis Pratt, Will be traipsing around the campground calling out you guys, as he has done in past years.. Please head down to field early -- so he can actually make it into this year's picture (He was too busy corralling laggards in 2021 that he missed the photo entirely!). href="https://mobile.twitter.com/DennisPrattFree"> Website . href="https://www.fsp.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Voluntaryist-Heart-only.jpg"> Image When: Sat, 2:00P _(30m) Where: FLD: Field, Field Note: Make sure the people you care about know about the upcoming photoshoot and herd them down to the field so they can mark this historic moment with you.

summary: Doggy Meetup on the Field Ron Paw [FLD]
description: For Whom: Four legged. Tail (cropped acceptable) but ever-wagging. Ears pointy, or floppy. Friendly. Greeting. Licks and belly rubs acceptable Responsible owners only please! Description: A classic of PF. Police the field while your dog meets his best tail-wagging buds. Please have your dog under control, and pick up any poop immediately. While you're chatting, do help clear the field of bottles, etc that the less-than-responsible may have left last night. Leave the field ready for the day! Belgian Tervuren: Ron Paw, Ron Paw has sniffed around the Free State for two and a half years now, and declares it is safe for all Porcupines. His first PF was 2021, but he was only a pup. Last year, was his teenage experience. This year he comes in as a young adult. He reclaims his title as Chef du Jeu of PF 2023, along with his 5 year old cockapoo companion, Queen Janey.. href="https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=2429056339595&set=t.1393626648&type=3"> Image When: Tue, 8:00A _(60m) Where: FLD: Field, Field Note: Doggies play 8A and 5P on the field each day.

The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. summary: So Many Regions, How do I Choose? Amber Daves, Constance Spenser [HOME]
description:
For Whom: New movers, potential movers and Porc's that want a better understanding of all the awesome regions in New Hampshire.
Description: Join us as an enthusiastic panel covers an overview of the regions of NH. Our panelists, current New Hampshire residents with expert knowledge of the state, will share insights on each of the state's distinct regions. This is the perfect event for anyone interested in exploring all that New Hampshire has to offer or seeking information about living in one of the state's regions. So whether you're a current resident, planning on moving to the state, or just curious to learn more about the different regions in New Hampshire, join us!
Organizer: Amber Daves
When: Wed, 5:00P (120m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field
Note: This is a brief overview, a more in-depth discussion will take place on Friday afternoon.

For Whom: Attendee who want to get up close and personal with Maj Toure. Description: Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. Speaker: Maj Toure, Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. On November 5, 2019, Toure finished 15th in a field of 17 candidates in the city's election, failing to secure a seat on the City Council. He received 5,676 votes (0.5% of the vote total).. href="https://solutionarylifestyle.org/"> Website . href="https://solutionarylifestyle.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/IMG_4976.jpg"> Image When: Fri, 1:00P _(60m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: Meet the Libertarian Politician and celebrity Maj Toure. href="https://solutionarylifestyle.org/">More Info

summary: Back To The Future: Women of the FSP Time Capsule Olga Sorens, Constance Spencer , Sarah Faber [HOME]
description: For Whom: Women of the Free State, both newbies and OG’s alike, who intend to be here in 10 years Description: To commemorate PorcFest XX, Women of the Free State will be putting together a time capsule to be opened at PorcFest XXX. Bring your favorite photos, small artifacts, and stories to commemorate the last 20 years and your intentions, aspirations, and plans for the next decade. Sangria will be served, laughs will be had, and good memories shared! It’s your chance to tell fellow ladies what you’d like to see in our Liberty Community and your ideas for how to get there. Creativity is greatly welcomed! Organizer: Olga Sorens Organizer: Constance Spencer , Constance is an early mover, co-producer of the PorcFest, and parent of four. She moved to New Hampshire during a difficult time in her life and has made a large impact on a number of other Free State movers as a Realtor and founder of independence Realty Group. She has a special passion for social issues that effect women and children and believes an intentional life is a political act. . href="https://independencerealtynh.com"> Website Organizer: Sarah Faber, When: Thu, 5:00P (120m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field

summary: State of the Market in NH Constance Spencer [HOME]
description: For Whom: People who need housing or market information Description: New Hampshire's real estate market is flourishing with high demand and low inventory. According to a report by the New Hampshire Association of Realtors, the median sales price of a single-family home has increased by 8.2% from last year. The state's low unemployment rate and an influx of out-of-state buyers are the primary reasons for this growth. However, this market has created a limited supply of affordable homes, making them more challenging to find. Our Team Lead and Real Estate Broker, Constance Spencer, will talk to you about the market and how to be successful in moving to the Libertarian Homeland! Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest. (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska, she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single-family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. href="IndependenceRealtyNH.com"> Website . href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CsR0-veLSoL/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA=="> Image When: Tue, 10:30A _(90m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: After the talk there will be time to ask questions of the Independence Realty Group's agents. href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CsR0-veLSoL/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==">More Info

summary: Buying a Home in New Hampshire-- The Process Michael Elliott [HOME]
description:
For Whom: First time home buyers
Description: Are you a first-time homebuyer looking to purchase a home in New Hampshire? Join Independence Realty's team for an informative event where seasoned FSP mover real estate agents will guide you through the various steps in the home-buying process.
Leader: Michael Elliott
When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field

summary: Questions to ask your agent Regan Elliott, Michael Elliott [HOME]
description:
For Whom: This event is ideal for anyone who is considering purchasing a home for the first time or is curious about the home-buying process and wants to be more informed. Join our team of FSP movers who made mistakes and became Realtors to help others avoid those mistakes. Learn from our experience!
Description: Join Independence Realty's experienced agents for an informative talk about the questions that first-time homebuyers should ask their real estate agents. This event will provide valuable insight into what to expect when purchasing your first home, and how to find the right real estate agent to guide you through the process. 
Panelist: Regan Elliott, Real estate agent, lawyer, mediator
When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field
Note: Our experienced team will guide you through: questions to ask real estate agents about the home buying process, tips for finding the right real estate agent for your needs, a review of common mistakes made by first-time homebuyers, how to identify a home that meets your requirements and within your budget, and understanding of the local real estate market and neighborhood dynamics.

description: For Whom: Ages 11+ Description: Join us for the return of Skoti-Alain Elliott, known for his fun & thought-provoking presentations on Critical Thinking: Mind over Murder. The story takes place on a deserted island where Quinn & Cooper must rely on their critical thinking skills to stay alive. Speaker: Skoti Elliott, Skoti-Alain Elliott has a strong background in physics, acoustics, and electronics. He began his career designing, building, and maintaining A-list recording studios in NYC. He then transitioned to engineering and mixing records, earning him several Platinum and Gold records. In 2004, he made a career change to web and software development. Skoti discovered his passion for teaching while instructing Audio Engineering at NYU and later teaching Application Development as a freelance instructor. That experience led him to create The Rational Apprentice (therationalapprentice.com). Skoti believes that making well-informed decisions, whether it's selecting the right microphone, writing the best algorithms, or making everyday choices in life, is directly related to obtaining quality information and using critical, rational, and logical thinking techniques.. href="www.therationalapprentice.com/book"> Website When: Fri, 12:00P _(60m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: During the event, Skoti will read excerpts from the book and generously gift complimentary copies to three audience members. summary: 4000 Footers with Derek Proulx Derek Proulx [HOME]
description:
For Whom: Anyone interested in a photographic tour or hiking the NH 4000 Footers and the Presidential Range.
Description: Derek Proulx is a well-versed hiker of the New Hampshire 4000 Footers and the Presidential Range. Derek's presentation covers preparation, equipment, safety measures, and the trails of the Presidential Range and the 4000 Footers. He will take you on a spectacular photo adventure during his presentation on New Hampshire's majestic mountains. This is a DO NOT MISS event for PorcFest attendee's, new or old.
Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is an NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is an avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all.

summary: Tar And Feather The Tyrants Jimmy Scamman [HOME]
description:
For Whom: New movers and porcs will enjoy the colorful history of New Hampshire. A must see and hear.
Description: Jimmy Scamman will present a historical view of liberty in New Hampshire. Jimmy's ancestors include verified passengers on the Mayflower (1620) and the first settlors in Piscataqua (1633), now Dover Point.
Speaker: Jimmy Scamman, Jimmy started studying his family history in 1972. He found 400 years of ancestry in New England including family ties to verified passengers on the Mayflower (1620). On the other side of his family history he found the original agent in charge of settling the Piscataqua area (1633), now known as Dover Point. Since then he has dedicated much of his spare time uncovering the tales and mystery's of New Hampshire. He is a founder and life member of the Stratham Historical Society. And yes, there will be a story of a tyrant who was tarred and feathered. 
When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field

summary: Life is Good: Morning AA meeting Mark Hansen [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: For anybody who is sober or trying to stay sober during the week, and for anybody who might be having a difficult time with substances and trying to stop. Are alcohol or other substances becoming overwhelming,  consuming, or taking over your life? Habits can become addictions for some people, and when it becomes a problem, it may be time to stop. When your body gets used to having foreign substances in it every day (such as alcohol), it may be physiologically very difficult to stop or change the habit/addiction. I’ve found it more helpful to talk with others who have actually gone through it, than to talk with counselors who haven’t. —Mark
Description: A morning group for those who will not be drinking and/or participating in extracurricular substances who would like to have a coffee, chat, or support and encourage each other to stay sober. 
Organizer: Mark Hansen, Mark Hansen, Mark has been sober for over 8 years. He realized that alcohol was becoming a problem in his life, and didn’t want to be remembered as being an alcoholic. He didn’t want his children to remember him that way, and he didn’t want alcohol to take his life. As a former park ranger and security officer at a hospital, he has seen his fair share of what alcohol addiction can do to a person. He has witnessed people going through detox. He has seen the physical and psychological effects of it, and he has seen people die from alcoholism and drug overdose. He didn’t want alcohol to win, so he decided to be a warrior to defeat it. Mark is teaching special education again, hiking, riding motorcycles, and enjoying the 2A and shooting sports these days. He is truly grateful to God (his higher power) for saving his life, and he’s giving credit where credit is due. Be a warrior. Life is Good. 
When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

For Whom: Knitters, Crocheters, Embroiderers, Tatters, Felters, Leatherworkers, Cross Stitchers, Needlepointers, Sewers, Spinners, Crafters, Beaders, etc, etc, etc, are all welcome to join us for some good old fashioned "Stitchin' an' Bitchin'". Bring a project and a drinking mug. We'll have hot water for tea, coffee, and maybe a sewing machine or two to use. Want to learn how to do these things? Come on over and we'll answer your questions and offer suggestions, but know that this is meant to be an informal hangout group, not a formal teaching class. Check out the separate teaching classes scattered throughout the schedule or watch a bunch of tutorials online so you can have a basic idea of what's involved. What are you waiting for? Come meet your new BFFs at this year's "Daily Stitch & Bitch"! Description: "Stitch and Bitch" groups have been around since before WWII, when they were composed primarily of knitters. In modern times, the S&B movement has gradually expanded to include all manner of crafters and fiber artists. Our PorcFest edition will of the modern type and will be a daily happening from noon to 2 PM at the FireSteel.com Canopy located at RV13. Organizer: Ilma & Friends, Ilma (the organizer) first learned how to crochet at the age of 8, and then 20 years later she learned how to knit in order to teach an actor to look legit while performing in a play that required knitting. She then proceeded to forget all about both of these techniques until about 12 years ago when her daughter needed help with some crochet stitches and she took up her hooks again. Then she took up her needles. Now she's got more projects than time. It's a certainty that all the other S&B-ers have similar stories. Come join us and tell us your own!. href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh"> Website When: Mon, 12:00P (120m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh">More Info

Then she took up her needles. Now she's got more projects than time. It's a certainty that all the other S&B-ers have similar stories. Come join us and tell us your own!. href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh"> Website When: Tue, 12:00P (120m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh">More Info

Bring a project and a drinking mug. We'll have hot water for tea, coffee, and maybe a sewing machine or two to use. Want to learn how to do these things? Come on over and we'll answer your questions and offer suggestions, but know that this is meant to be an informal hangout group, not a formal teaching class. A newly published "bare minimum" book about the Croydon Budget Battle will also be available for purchase and autograph by the author. Leader: Jody Underwood, Jody Underwood, then chair of the Croydon school board, had to clean up the mess that Ian instigated. summary: Discourse on The Yoga Sutras of Patanjali Andrew Noveske [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: Anyone interested in eastern knowledge systems, yoga, tantra, the Bagavad Gita, and Hinduism/Buddhism. Anyone with questions on translation or relevant meaning of Sanskrit text.
Description: Discussion of yoga in its original Sanskrit with English translation and explanation. What its implications are for Tantra, Advaita Vedanta and its relationship to Samkhya.
Speaker: Andrew Noveske, Andrew has a working knowledge of the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali , as well as a working knowledge of Sanskrit. He is a student of Yoga and Advaita Vedanta under a Himalayan master. His family hails from Kerala, India - and he was raised with access to these systems via his family, language and culture. 

His interest is in dispelling misconceptions surrounding Yoga, and Hinduism in general that are the result of gulf of perspective that exists between eastern and western philosophical understanding of consciousness and spirituality. 
When: Thu, 7:00P (120m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13
Note: Please bring any material you want discussed.

He has been speaking and writing about peaceful separation since 2017, and he has written 8 books about liberty and secession.. href="LibertyBlock.com"> Website When: Wed, 8:00P _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 href="AluAxelman.com">More Info

description:

For Whom: A meet-and-greet event for women of Porcfest who are interested in firearms, from EDC experts to gun-curious new movers. Kate will provide an introduction to carrying specifically with considerations for concealment as a woman, during pregnancy, with kids, and getting the confidence to get started. We’ll talk about what we carry, what we shoot, where and how, and answer questions as a group. BYO holsters and gear if you have a favorite that works well on the female form. If you’d like to share your gun with the group, please come unloaded! 
Description: Meet and greet for women who own guns, shoot guns, or are curious about guns and would like to learn more. If you carry, bring your favorite gear; if you don’t, bring your most burning questions. 
Organizer: Kate Ziegler, MA LTC, EDC in NH and MA, and organizer of last year’s Girls with Guns
When: Sat, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

For Whom: People who want to learn to knit. If you know how to knit, come hang out and/or help the beginners. Description: Have you always wanted to try knitting or want to get re-acquainted? Join us for a beginner class. We will learn the basics, and when you're done you can keep going to make a garter stitch scarf! We will also talk about how knitting is not just a fun hobby, but can be a useful skill for survival and self-sufficiency. Instructor: Karen, Karen has been a knitter for many years and likes teaching people things. When: Tue, 10:00A _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 Note: What to bring: - Knitting needles in size US 7 or larger, - A ball of *light colored* yarn that works with your needles. - Willingness to learn, patience, and acceptance of mistakes Note: We will have a very limited amount of supplies to learn with, but you will not be able to take them with you. href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh">More Info

For Whom: Curious about Crochet? Then come to this basic class/overview of the foundation techniques. If you have them, bring those crochet hooks that have been taunting you in the corner gathering dust. If you don't have a kit, we'll have some with which to practice during the class and some others you can purchase so you can continue to practice after the class or at one of our many "Stitch & Bitch" gatherings throughout the week. Alternately, you can get your own yarn, hooks and/or a basic kit at the Walmart in Littleton, which is on the way to Roger's. If you're buying your own kit to bring, just: 1. Select a small skein of a light colored acrylic or cotton material (easier to see the stitches than with a dark color) in a worsted or sport weight (look on the label for the yarn weight). Number 4 is best. 2. Look at the yarn's label to see what size hook is recommended. You should see a picture of a hook with the size next to it. Bring that size hook or buy one if you don't have one already. 3. Ask an attendant at the store for help if you're not sure what to get. 4. Watch some beginner YouTube videos or buy a beginner "How to Crochet" book. It'll all make sense quicker if you've prepared before you come to PorcFest. 5. Show up to class on Tuesday with your kit and say Hi!!! Description: This is a beginner class where your fabulous instructor will teach you (or help you relearn) the basics. You will learn how to do a chain stitch and a "single crochet" stitch in this class. Master these stitches and you can start making crochet hats, scarves, blankets, and the like. See you there! Instructor: Kristin Alpert, Kristin learned to crochet when she was a pre-teen from her grandmother. She then let it slide while she attended Nursing school and started raising a family. In 2005, Kristin started crocheting again and found it was like riding a bike; everything came back to her! She finds it very relaxing and rewarding and especially enjoys making items which she gifts or donates to various causes. She hopes this class will spark interest and future learning for others.. href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh"> Website When: Tue, 11:00A _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 Note: Join us for the "Daily Stitch & Bitch" from noon-2 all week (Monday to Saturday), and practice what you'll learn in this class! href="https://t.me/+Ap_JN5REOxY2OTlh">More Info

summary: Real Science Requires Real Freedom Jorge Besada [FIRE]
description: For Whom: Everyone interested in the theoretical foundations of how the economy works and why we keep falling for coercive central planning, especially in science. Description: Real Science Requires Real Freedom: An Introduction to ‘Austrian Economics’ And The Libertarian Party’s Science Caucus A brief yet accessible introduction to how the economy-world works and has evolved as explained by the economists of the so-called 'Austrian School' and a discussion on how central planning has wrecked science culminating in the recent CovidMania. Speaker: Jorge Besada, Speaker. href="https://lpsciencecaucus.com/"> Website When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 Note: We will discuss: 1) How the rapidly growing complexity of the social order led to Socialist mythology leading to the rise and fall of various Socialist-Communist governments. 2) How the complexity of the biochemical order, coupled with coercive competition immune government bureucracies, has led to the propagation of the mythical 'Germ Theory of Disease' and related myths like the alleged benefits of vaccination, the entire field of Virology, and various nutritional myths and more. 3) Introduce the newly-created Libertarian Party's Science caucus to help unite people looking to spread real freedom and competition in Science. 4) Briefly discuss the new book 'Real Science Requires Real Freedom: An Introduction To ‘Austrian Economics’ And The Libertarian Party’s Science Caucus' which expands on all topics brought up in talk. href="https://lpsciencecaucus.com">More Info

summary: Show Me Your EDC and I'll Show You Mine Mark Hansen [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: Anyone interested in EDC is welcome to join us! Let’s talk about what you currently carry, how you carry it, and what you COULD and SHOULD carry every day. We all carry a wallet or purse, phone, and keys every day, right? Do you carry a firearm, extra magazines, tourniquet, flashlight, multi-tool, etc…? How do you carry it? Where do you carry on your body? With what clothing do you carry? Belts? Holsters? Knives? Pepper spray? Let’s talk. I’ll show you what I carry, where, and when. And I’ll share my thoughts about it. What do you carry? Let’s chat! See you there!! 
Description: What do you carry everywhere, everyday in your pockets besides your wallet, phone and keys? EDC, or “Every Day Carry” is a hot topic these days. Let’s talk about what you currently carry, what you SHOULD carry, and where and how to carry it. 
Speaker: Mark Hansen , Mark is currently a special ed teacher in Connecticut. He is also a former hospital security officer and former CT state parks ranger. He enjoys hiking, firearms, and motorcycles, and this will be Mark’s third Porcfest. Since his first Porcfest, he has returned to New Hampshire several times to hike the White Mountains, visit with friends, and to practice and take classes in pistol and rifle techniques. 
He carries everywhere, everyday! 
When: Wed, 4:00P _(60m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

summary: Protecting The Open Internet Caleb James DeLisle [FIRE]
description: For Whom: People interested in internet freedom, mesh networking, wifi sharing, restaurant / hotel guest wifi systems. Description: From citizen media and online communities, to anonymous leak platforms, the internet has been the base layer for almost all libertarian progress over the past 20 years. However the enemies of freedom are working hard to curtail that system. These efforts have so far been unsuccessful, but they are becoming more sophisticated and internet freedom is far from guaranteed. This talk is about the nature of the battle, and what is needed to secure a more permanent winning position. I present the PKT blockchain, cjdns protocol, and PKT Pal company, and how each of these is working to cover ground in the fight for a permanently open internet. Speaker: Caleb James DeLisle, Caleb James DeLisle, Open Source Developer, creator of cjdns encrypted mesh networking protocol, CryptPad collaborative editor, PacketCrypt bandwidth-hard proof-of-work & PKT blockchain. CTO: pktpal.com The free and open internet must be defended at all costs.. href="https://pkteerium.xyz/media/e1f10d396fbee88906c61dc0c412471a49ae210ec8d12c2b228a003ba8c811d8.png"> Image When: Sat, 9:00P _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

summary: Pine Tree Radio Society Intro to emergency comms Jack Shimek [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: 
Description: PTRS shows how everyone can easily use basic radios to communicate in emergencies.
Speaker: Jack Shimek, Jack is a long-time activist who became involved in radio at an early age. His technical experience in industry taught him how to turn technical processes into easy systems for the average person to learn.
When: Mon, 5:00P (120m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13
Note: The Pine Tree Radio Society was organized by New Hampshire folks concerned about being able to continue communications in cases of emergencies where other services are down. Members are intent on helping everyone who wants to become radio-capable to learn basic skills and acquire basic radio equipment that could save their lives.

Jack and other PTRS members will review the Pine Tree Radio Society’s plan that would allow emergency communications to continue throughout the state. You don’t have to become a radio wizard, because PTRS radioactivists will train people in 15 minute sessions in reaching a basic level of competency which will allow them to communicate with the outside world, in case of snow storms or other emergencies.

Economical radio equipment will be for sale at PorcFest and training will be available all week long in the AltExpo tent, RV52 in Agora Valley.

Speaker: Lazer Axelman, Lazer Axelman served as a member of the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine from 2020 until the war began in 2022 as manager and chief clinician of the attached paramedic team, and returned to Ukraine in April of 2022 on a small tactical medical team operating at the front line in eastern Ukraine. For Whom: Anyone who is interested in a very basic and general discussion about body armor should attend. Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60
Note: Among the most dangerous mountains in the world, Mount Washington has challenged adventurers for centuries with its severe weather. From the days when gentlefolk ascended the heights in hoop skirts and wool suits to today's high-tech assaults on wintry summits. 

The White Mountains of New Hampshire consist of a series of mountains whose maximum elevation reaches 6,288 feet (1,917 m) and represent some of the highest mountains in the United States east of the Mississippi River. Fatalities in this area are dominated by those that occur on Mount Washington, the highest peak in the range. It is notorious for its unpredictable and inclement weather, making it one of the deadliest mountains in the continental United States. Due to its unique location relative to other geographic features, it holds the world record for highest recorded surface wind speed not within a tropical cyclone. The New Hampshire Fish and Game Department conducts an average of 200 rescues a year for hikers in need of assistance. Mt. Washington has had more fatalities per vertical foot than any other mountain in the world.

We'll be taking a look at a few notable cases of disasterous climbs in the White Mountains, why these catastophes occur, details of the unique geography and weather, and steps YOU can take to make sure your hike doesn't end tragically.

For Whom: Hikers, nature lovers, outdoor enthusiasts
Description: Join experienced hiker, Derek Proulx, as he unpacks his bag and shows off the essential hiking gear he uses to camp and summit some of the most dangerous mountains in the world.
Speaker: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all.
When: Sat, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60

summary: Women Finding Support in the Free State Carol Pratt, Jess Pelletier [FSBV]
description:
For Whom: All women, particularly those who are considering the move to New Hampshire and wondering about community, support, children, love, family, etc.

Description: For many women, the idea of moving to a new state is daunting. The support from her long-time community of family and old friends can make her hesitate, no matter how much her (or her partner’s) libertarian worldview may clash with the politics currently surrounding her. Hear the experiences of a panel of women who made the move to New Hampshire as part of the Free State Project -- with or without a partner, and with or without children -- and share your own stories in small group discussions led by the panelists.

Time built in for socializing, refreshments and shopping the wares offered by based and beautiful Free State women following the program. 
Moderator: Carol Pratt, A recent retiree to New Hampshire, Carol considers herself a "LIVE FREE befORe you DIE" Free Stater. She lives in Dover NH with her husband, Dennis, and is active in many of the community-building projects he initiated, including The SHELL (a welcoming libertarian community center in the Seacoast region) and The Independence Inn (including its restaurant/bar, Heartwood), the premier liberty-oriented inn and public house in the world, located in Strafford NH.
Organizer: Jess Pelletier,

For Whom: People who like to quote constitutions Description: Because they assume powers that cannot be delegated, the federal and state constitutions are ultimately unsuitable as foundations for liberty. I will explain why basing arguments on them is not effective and is likely to be counterproductive. Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. href="https://www.bareminimumbooks.com/"> Website When: Wed, 5:00P _(60m) Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60 href="https://www.bareminimumbooks.com/">More Info

summary: Secession debate: Axelman v. Villee!!! Alu Axelman, Stephen Villee [FSBV]
description: For Whom: Those interested in secession, debate, separation movements, and liberty! Description: Stephen Villee thinks that we should work to get the US government and NH to agree to part ways...Alu thinks NH should just secede! Who will make the better argument???? You decide!! Debater: Alu Axelman, Alu is the founder and editor-in-chief of LibertyBlock.com and President of the Foundation for NH Independence. He has been speaking and writing about peaceful separation since 2017, and he has written 8 books about liberty and secession. . href="AluAxelman.com"> Website Debater: Stephen Villee, Stephen Villee moved to New Hampshire from New York City in December 2003. He is a software engineer who enjoys hiking, yoga, and traveling to see solar eclipses. He previously served as treasurer of the New Hampshire Liberty Alliance, and currently serves as treasurer of the Free State Project. He produced a youtube video called “Proclivity for Taxing Income” about secession as a way to be free of federal income tax. For Whom: Friends, family, or acquaintances of FSP participants who have passed away within the last year, or anyone else interested in honoring them even if you didn't know them. 
Description: As the number of Free State Project participants has grown, so too have the number of those who have departed our midst. Each year we gather to honor the lives of those who are no longer with us by gathering for a time of remembrance. There will be no formal presentation, but friends and family of those who have passed on are welcome to share brief thoughts or stories about our loved ones. The 1:30-2:30 time in the Liberty Ecclesia tent overlaps other sessions to allow for people to come and go without missing an important session.
Host: Varrin Swearingen, Varrin is the Liberty Ecclesia Lead Organizer and has hosted several PorcFest memorial services.
When: Wed, 1:30P _(60m)
Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2

summary: Libertarian Idiosyncrasies of Mormon Doctrine Michael South [LE]
description:
For Whom: Christian libertarians, Free Staters interested in another potential source of libertarians who already live in NH, and anyone interested in the interplay between religion and libertarianism should find this of interest. 
Description: Mormonism (the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints) is considered by Mormons to be a Christian religion. Part of what makes this statement questionable for many Christians is that Mormons have books in addition to the Bible that are considered by Mormons to be equally scriptural. This talk will focus on a set of teachings from these additional books (that is, doctrines unique to Mormonism) which are profoundly libertarian (way more libertarian, in fact, than the average Mormon!).  We'll go over these beliefs and some of their implications.
Speaker: Michael South, Michael is a direct descendant of the earliest Mormon leaders and an active member of the church. Having discovered libertarianism by accident, subsequent study of Mormon scripture has put him on a mission to convert all of his fellow Mormons to a belief in liberty that is fully grounded in their own religious belief system.
When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2

summary: Freedom Haven project: How the Gospel can thrive Tony Olsen [LE]
description: For Whom: Christians who believe in the importance of socioeconomic freedom Description: A society based on force and compulsion negatively affects our spirituality, while a society based on freedom encourages and nourishes it. By 2037, the Freedom Haven project will liberate us from governmental captivity to make it easier for us to connect with God and eventually achieve our divine potential. Speaker: Tony Olsen, Tony Olsen is the chief architect of the Freedom Haven project and former missionary of the Gospel of Jesus Christ in former East Germany. He lived in West Germany a total of 4.5 years when he was a child, and then went on a mission to East Germany shortly after the wall came down. What he experienced there, and what he learned from the Gospel of Jesus Christ, opened his eyes to the importance of religious freedom and socioeconomic freedom in general.. href="https://FreedomHaven.org"> Website When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2 href="https://FreedomHaven.org">More Info

summary: Government Obedience, Key Bible Passages Varrin Swearingen [LE]
description: For Whom: Anyone, Christian or otherwise, interested in detailed insights into the Bible passages most often used to advocate unqualified Christian obedience to government. Note: although we may be able to survey these passages in 60 minutes, discussion usually runs long for this topic. Therefore, we have 90 minutes of time blocked out to allow for sufficient Q&A. Description: Does the Bible really require Christians to obey government without question? Did Jesus say taxes were good? We will review portions of Romans 13, 1 Peter 2, and Matthew 22, which are often used to extol the goodness of government and taxation. Speaker: Varrin Swearingen, Varrin is the Liberty Ecclesia Lead Organizer.. href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/LibertyEcclesia/"> Website When: Fri, 3:00P _(90m) Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2 href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/LibertyEcclesia/">More Info

We’ll explore LSD (Light, Slow and Deep) breathing, and then flow into learning how to “light your inner fire” via the potent power of hormetic breathing (based on the ancient Tibetan “Tummo” practice). Facilitator: Rob Williams, Rob is a retired yak farmer and performing "folk funk” musician, Rob is devoted to ice baths, hot saunas, cold showers, running, trekking, skiing, snowboarding, ultimate frisbee, and all sports aquatic, and spends as much time as possible every day Outside, often in the company of his grass-fed yak meat food cart and Taylor travel guitar. description: For Whom: Anyone with cryptocurrency holdings looking to avoid capital gains tax or diversify into real estate for income and peace of mind. For Whom: Those who wish to travel armed between US states Description: A discussion on driving and flying in these united states with a gun, reducing the risks of violating the wide variety of anti-gun rules of state and federal governments. The event focuses on handguns carried for personal protection, held at the quiet Rebel Civics hub at the top of the hill under the trees. This will be a small event with plenty of Q&A and discussion time. Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith has traveled by car to PorcFest three times from South Florida while armed, camping on the way up and back, and spent months traveling and living in the camper with a handgun. He has flown to Montana, Philadelphia, Portland ME, and Burlington VT from Florida with a checked handgun. So far Keith as been to 17 states with a handgun. His girlfriend is weary of The Talk on crossing each state line about yet another set of gun rules. Crossing a line can go from being allowed to carry in a grocery store, to the firearm must be unloaded and locked in the safe with the ammo in a separate hard-sided locked container. Some states we can legally open carry in the national forest campgrounds and in some states we are not allowed to camp in the forest at all because we have a gun. This takes research and should not be taken lightly, as jail is a distinct possibility in the communist US states. Keith has a Florida CWL, an NRA Range Safety Officer (RSO) certification, and passed the classroom training, test, and range qual for the Florida Class D Security Officer and Class G Armed Security licenses. Professionally, Keith is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications systems for military aircraft, ships, and submarines. Keith hosts the Rebel Civics show on Unsafe Space, writes for UncoverDC and Liberty Block, and is Admin of the FLexit Facebook group.. href="https://rumble.com/c/UnsafeSpace"> Website . href="https://scontent-mia3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/349086324_1611822559286445_5541692000701724557_n.jpg?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=5cd70e&_nc_ohc=Yj27thTjSNUAX_a2kKO&_nc_ht=scontent-mia3-2.xx&oh=00_AfBI6ePU72tiysobAJ6jiIVU5fANGRP1qhgRSiZaYgixGw&oe=647658A9"> Image When: Tue, 1:00P _(60m) Where: REBL: Rebel Civics - Unsafe Space, T50 Note: Traveling these united states with a firearm for personal protection requires managing the risk of governments who gleefully infringe on your natural right to keep and bear arms. Rules vary enormously state by state. It is prudent to research and follow requirements for each state one is traveling through and stopping in. Selection of firearms, accessories, and ammunition is critical. Transport locations and locking equipment matter. href="https://www.unsafespace.com">More Info

summary: Declaration of Independence for Teens & Pints Keith Bessette, Jefferson [REBL]
description: For Whom: Students age 10+ who want to know what the Declaration really is and what it did Description: The purpose and meaning of the Declaration of Independence, pointing out some of the 27 grievances against the King in 1776 still apply today, followed by a Q&A and discussion. Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith has guest taught the Constitution at home school collaboratives and government camps to classes ranging from 6th to 12 grades. He hosts the weekly show Rebel Civics, teaching a range of civics topics and the Founder's view of how society should be arranged. Keith writes for UncoverDC, Liberty Block, and Unsafe Space. He is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications electronics and systems for military applications.. href="https://unsafespace.com"> Website . href="https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=7007045405978991&set=g.397890262019481"> Image Co-host: Jefferson, Jefferson won the 2022 PorcFest Soapbox Idol competition with his awesome talk on how the virus lockdowns ruined his life, and is named after the guy who wrote the Declaration of Independence. summary: Strength Training- The Squat, Bench, and Deadlift Micah Deshaies [GYM]
description: For Whom: Folks new or interested in strength training with barbells Description: This one is interactive! We will teach you how to safely squat, bench, and deadlift. As we are teaching each lift we will talk about basic programming of exercises. Many people "exercise", they get sweaty and sore but they don't "train". Training is when you have a goal in mind and a specific plan to get there. For beginners we have found that a basic method called Starting Strength by Mark Rippetoe is a great place to get started. At the end of this mini seminar you will have a basic lifting program and a coach will teach you proper form on the squat, bench, and deadlift No experience necessary. Wear stretchy pants or shorts. Location RV129 or the overflow parking area next to RV129 Organizer: Micah Deshaies, Owner of Free State Barbell Club in Manchester, NH. For Whom: Vivek fans, Vivek haters, NH Republican primary voters, fans of open debate and the free exchange of ideas Description: After he wraps up his main event appearance in the PAV, join us at the Vivek Ramaswamy Politics Hub for extended Q&A with Vivek. He loves open and honest discussion, and he'll answer your questions. How often does a presidential candidate say that? Speaker: Vivek Ramaswamy, Vivek Ramaswamy, Vivek Ramaswamy is the first millennial to run for the Republican nomination for president. He is an American business leader and the author of books including Woke, Inc.: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam and Capitalist Punishment: How Wall Street is Using Your Money to Create a Country You Didn't Vote For. The media has called him the "intellectual godfathers of the anti-woke movement." Vivek helped identify and popularize discussion of wokeism in mainstream conservative thought. Born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio, Vivek was valedictorian of his high school, went on to graduate summa cum laude in Biology from Harvard and received his J.D. from Yale Law School, while working at a hedge fund. He later started a biotech company, Roivant Sciences, where he oversaw the development of five drugs that went on to become FDA-approved. In 2022, he founded Strive, an Ohio-based asset management firm that directly competes with asset managers like BlackRock, State Street, Vanguard and others, use the money of everyday citizens to advance environmental and social agendas that many citizens and capital owners disagree with. Vivek is married to Apoorva, a throat surgeon and Assistant Professor at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center. They live in Columbus, Ohio where they are raising their two sons.. href="https://www.vivek2024.com/"> Website When: Sat, 11:30A _(90m) Where: POL: The Political Parlor, RV5 href="https://www.vivek2024.com/">More Info

For Whom: Anyone with a really strong belief about some aspect of liberty in the world, which they can passionately express in three minutes, and which they would like to share with the entire festival in our concluding event on Saturday.
Description: The SoapBox Idol competition is the penultimate event of PorcFest. It ends our formal program on Saturday afternoon. And it's your opportunity to share your three minute rant for freedom and against tyranny. But so great is the desire of our Porcupines and Porcupine-wannabes to cry out for freedom, that we hold auditions at which you practice your rant with Queen Quill.
