We welcome everyone and can teach you to you cut, light, and *not* inhale.

summary: Ham Radio Meetup Seamus Casey, Robley Hall [SLL]
description:
For Whom: Are you interested in amateur radio (commonly called "ham radio")?  Whether for the technical challenges, emergency preparedness, community service, or just plain fun of it, amateur radio has a lot to offer!  If you'd like to know more, and/or are already a ham wanting to have an "eyeball QSO" (yes, we do use some strange lingo at times) with other other hams, come on by!  This will include a hands-on demonstration of various modes of radio communications, and as much technical explanation as you might want.  Seamus (N1IOX) and Robley (KC1BVL) both possess the "Extra" class of license, and have a combined 40+ years of experience with the hobby.
Description: Learn all about radio communications
Host: Seamus Casey
Host: Robley Hall,

Where: SLL: Seacoast Liberty Lounge / The SHELL, Red Cabin

For Whom: Anyone with any questions for a libertarian MD
Description: Medical questions
Medical concerns
Thoughts that the medical industrial complex might not have your best interest in mind? 
 "Ask the Doctor " continues the annual  tradition where you can ask Dr. Jim Laurenzano what is on your mind in an open small group setting. Dr. Laurenzano has been practicing clinical medicine for 40+ years and enjoys discussing the issues of the day from a libertarian perspective of shared decision making.
 
There is no need to prepare anything in advance-Just join in the discussion.

If  you do not have anything prepared, Dr. Laurenzano will have something to lead off the discussion. 

:

For Whom: That’s data on previous engagements, not the other kind. 
Do you have your long gun with you?  Do you need to establish a solid zero?  Do you need to chronograph your preferred load?  Do you want to calculate and test your elevation changes for distances out to 700 yards?  I can help a very small group of people with this. This is not a beginner or newbie session. This is for experienced shooters who need a little long distance range time. If time allows we might be able to change locations and reach out way beyond 700 if needed. We will have limited time available so come prepared. Are your base and rings properly torqued? Have your ballistic app downloaded and all of your rifle and load data entered ahead of time. I’ll provide a lab radar chronograph to get your actual velocity while verifying your 100 yard zero. If you would like one of the very few spots in this session come look me up at the North Country Porcupine Lounge Monday through Thursday or very early Friday morning and we can discuss what you are looking to accomplish and directions or transportation to the range. A completely optional generous donation to range upkeep and improvements will gladly be accepted but not required or expected.

For Whom: Informal chat about life in the North Country.  Northern NH (North of the Notches) is often referred to as the “North Country”.  Are you curious or do you have questions about life in the North Country?  Weather, jobs, housing, community, homesteading, shopping, groceries, local foods, entertainment, outdoors, shooting, snowmobiles, ATV’s, snowfall amounts, how cold does it get, growing seasons, etc..  Stop by and get answers straight from the people who actually live here.  These conversations are not limited to this time slot.  Stop by the lounge anytime and chat with locals.

summary: How to Write and Publish a Book w/ Scott Horton Scott Horton [TLI]
description: For Whom: Potential authors. Description: Come by the Libertarian Institute hub, grab a beer, and listen to Scott Horton tell you everything he's learned about how to write and publish a book. : Scott Horton, Scott Horton is director of the Libertarian Institute, editorial director of Antiwar.com, host of Antiwar Radio on Pacifica, 90.7 FM KPFK in Los Angeles, California and podcasts the Scott Horton Show from ScottHorton.org. He's the author of the 2021 book Enough Already: Time to End the War on Terrorism, the 2017 book, Fool's Errand:Time to End the War in Afghanistan, editor of the 2019 book The Great Ron Paul: The Scott Horton Show Interviews 2004–2019 and the 2022 book Hotter Than The Sun: Time to Abolish Nuclear Weapons. He’s conducted more than 5,800 interviews since 2003.. href="https://libertarianinstitute.org/scott/"> Website When: Thu, 5:00P _(60m) Where: TLI: The Libertarian Institute, RV37 href="https://www.amazon.com/Enough-Already-Time-End-Terrorism/dp/1733647341">More Info

description: For Whom: Those who are passionate about obtain ALL of our socioeconomic freedoms for us and others in this lifetime. For Whom: Students age 10 and up interested in what the Constitution is Description: An overview of the Constitution from the Founder’s view; why it was created, what it really means, what it does, and what it does not do. Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith has guest taught the Constitution at home school collaboratives and government camps to classes ranging from 6th to 12 grades. He hosts the weekly show Rebel Civics, teaching a range of civics topics and the Founder's view of how society should be arranged. Keith writes for UncoverDC, Liberty Block, and Unsafe Space. He is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications electronics and systems for military applications.. href="https://constitutioncenter.org/media/files/constitution.pdf"> Website . href="https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=7007045405978991&set=gm.799311845210652&type=3&mibextid=r5uJeJ"> Image When: Mon, 4:00P _(60m) Where: Teen: PorcuTeens, Blue Cabin Note: The Constitution is how the States created the federal government, how they assigned it powers, and how they limited what it is legally allowed to do.

summary: Queer (gay / LGBT+) Mixer: Solstice Edition Greg M., Jeff Y. [BFV]
description: For Whom: Description: Come meet and mingle with other queer porcupines at the friendliest camp of them all, Body Freedom Village! You can dance if you want to, or you can stargaze from the hot tub under the solstice moon. Celestial outfits encouraged! BFV has space for tents and vendors for those that are a good fit! summary: Singles+ Mixer at Body Freedom Village Jeff Y. [BFV]
description: For Whom: Friendly, open-minded singles and electron-deficient polycules. Description: Come meet and mingle with other single+ porcupines at the friendliest camp of them all, Body Freedom Village! (The "+" is for couples wanting a polycule, etc.) If there's just a few people, we'll lounge, hang out, and play some games. If there's a bunch of people, then get ready to dance! summary: Radical Expression Dance Party: Blacklight Jungle Jeff Y. [BFV]
description: For Whom: Friendly, open-minded porcupines! Camp is clothing optional. Self expression is encouraged and all body types are welcome. This event is 18+, as is BFV after sunset. Description: It's the last night of PorcFest, and your last chance to celebrate freedom until 2024! We'd love to see you in your favorite Victorian cage crinoline, your pirate costume, your fairy wings, your neon body paint, or your birthday suit! This year, the dance floor will be adorned with blacklights and jungle decorations. If you want to be camouflaged, consider dressing up as a safari hunter, or getting body painted as a jungle animal! Professional body painter onsite! Come dance at the friendliest camp at PorcFest, or warm up in the hot tub (assuming it hasn't popped yet!). Either way, have fun and omg please help us consume our remaining snacks and bevys! Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region!. href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023"> Website When: Sat, 10:30P (120m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: This year we are honored to have guest DJ Roodless Cosmopolitan. DJ Rootless Cosmopolitan is a DJ and VJ at venues around the world, including being a resident at Eighteenth Street Lounge (Washington D.C.), Red Pearl (Huntington Beach, CA), and Ibiza (Huntington Beach, CA), and a guest at JetSet (Moscow), Lazarum (Dubrovnik), Lounge (Beijing), and the Sheraton Hotel (Doha). Music styles range from San Francisco style deep house to Berlin-style techno to dreamy global soundscapes with fat basslines. href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023">More Info

summary: Mindfulness Meditation for All w/ Mike R. Michael R. [BFV]
description: For Whom: ξενία: All who come in peace are welcome here This is a family-friendly event in a clothing-optional village. Kids must be accompanied by parent. Feel free to reach out for any reason to Mike at 6039320243, especially if this will be your first mindfulness meditation for preemptive encouragement. Description: Join us as we reconnect with the ever present simplicity of being. Non-judgmental present moment awareness. All experience levels will be embraced as Mike R. invites you to join him on a spontaneous journey into the interior. Michael Rohan is a meditation practitioner of, woah, eight years already. He has Shambhala level one, and has sought guidance and inspiration from Jon Kabat-Zinn, John Vervaeke, as well as others. Consider taking advantage of the meditation location, BFV, as you will be free to dress according to your comfort and preference. Facilitator: Michael R., Michael Rohan is a meditation practitioner of, woah, eight years already. He has Shambhala level one, and has sought guidance and inspiration from Jon Kabat-Zinn, John Vervaeke, as well as others. When: Thu, 9:00A _(60m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Please bring your own meditation cushion, blanket, pillow, chair or whatever you'd like to sit comfortably. If arriving late or leaving early, please simply be courteous of other mediators. href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023">More Info

For Whom: Alt lifestyle is for the queer, the kinksters, the outliers, the seekers of experience
Description: 18+ event! We are back again for PFXX! Alt-Lifestyles presents the freest munch on the planet. Come one and all! Interested in moving to NH but concerned you won't find like-minded people in leather or latex? We are here, and come from a vibrant and growing scene. Living in NH already but missing that spark of S&M? Meet your fellow explorers in outer experiences and see where we have been hiding. While here, thank our fabulous hosts at BFV and experience the finest hot tub at PorcFest.
Organizer: Chris
When: Fri, 7:00P _(90m)
Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210

For Whom: This is a clothing-optional camp. All friendly bodies are welcome; kids must be accompanied by a parent. Parental discretion is advised. Trigger warning: guns, nudity, and adult humor. Description: “I haven’t put much thought into my attire + gun + holster,” said no libertarian ever. Do you have so much camo that you need to strut down a runway for anyone to notice you? Want to show off how you can carry a BFG while wearing 6 inch heels? Want to show the best solution you found for a nudist to carry? Perhaps you fashion yourself a cowboy? Then come on down to Body Freedom Village to showcase your (bits and) pieces! For those that want to express or exaggerate their feminine side, wigs and makeup will be available. Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region! When: Thu, 3:00P _(90m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Please arrive early if you want to walk the runway. We'll probably start late! Toy and water guns are acceptable. Immaculate gun safety handling required. href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023/number new-gun-fashion-show">More Info

For Whom: Everyone is encouraged to participate, regardless of athletic prowess! All friendly bodies welcome; kids must be accompanied by a parent. This is a family-friendly event in a clothing-optional village. Description: Does your paleo diet make you an ideal human specimen? Does your mastery of stoicism enable you to perform superhuman feats of strength? Is winning the only outcome Rand would find rational? Then put your mettle to the test at the Nude Olympics at Body Freedom Village for your chance to win a collectible certificate of accomplishment! Last year, Goldbacks also sponsored real gold and silver prizes! Events include things like throwing a shot put (medicine ball). Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region! When: Fri, 3:00P (120m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Participants must be nude. Shoes welcome. We don't want you to twist an ankle! href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023">More Info

For Whom: Artists and anyone who wants to try drawing. You don’t need any experience with drawing to participate. This is a family-friendly event in a clothing-optional village. Kids must be accompanied by a parent. Description: There is a long and deep history of artists drawing the nude figure. This is your opportunity to draw a live model in that tradition. No experience necessary! 30 min of instruction will be offered, and followed by a 90 min drawing session. Instructor: Franklin Assistant & Model: Karen L., When: Sat, 11:00A (120m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Kits including a sketch pad, 2B pencil and kneaded eraser will be available for $10 if you don’t have your own supplies. The class is otherwise free. href="https://nudists.forliberty.org/bfv-2023">More Info

summary: Live Free and Hike Derek Proulx, Reed Coverdale [FSBL]
description: For Whom: Hikers Description: Hiking in the White Mountains - Caps Ridge Trail to Mt Jefferson Summit. Difficulty: HARD Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all. Leader: Reed Coverdale, Host of the Naturalist Capitalist. Hiker. Truck Driver. Free Stater. Free Thinker. When: Mon, 7:00A (360m) Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59 Note: We will be meeting at the Free State Based(FSBL) tentsite area(59/60) at 7AM sharp. This a first come first serve trip. First 6 to show up get to come on the hike. We have 2 vehicles that Derek Proulx and Reed Coverdale will drive for transportation to and from the trailhead. Trailheads are approximately 35 minutes from Rogers. Time to return is approximately 1PM. Caps Ridge Trail is a 4.3-mile out-and-back trail near Mount Washington to the summit of Mt Jefferson. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 4 h 5 min to complete. Nicknamed the "Fastest Route to the Jet Stream" this trail is steep and rocky. Please come prepared with your own backpack, food, water, and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. href="https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/new-hampshire/caps-ridge-trail--2">More Info

Trailheads are approximately 35 minutes from Rogers. Time to return is approximately 10AM. Artist Bluff is a 1.5-mile loop trail near Franconia, New Hampshire. It takes an average of 53 min to complete. This is arguably the best views for the easiness of the hike in the whole state. Please come prepared with your own water and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. href="https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/new-hampshire/artist-bluff-trail">More Info

summary: Live Free and Hike Derek Proulx, Reed Coverdale [FSBL]
description: For Whom: Hikers Description: Hiking in the White Mountains - Mt Willard. Difficulty: MODERATE Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all. Leader: Reed Coverdale, Host of the Naturalist Capitalist. Hiker. Truck Driver. Free Stater. Free Thinker. When: Sat, 7:00A (240m) Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59 Note: We will be meeting at the Free State Based(FSBL) tentsite area(59/60) at 7AM sharp. This a first come first serve trip. First 6 to show up get to come on the hike. We have 2 vehicles that Derek Proulx and Reed Coverdale will drive for transportation to and from the trailhead. Trailheads are approximately 35 minutes from Rogers. Time to return is approximately 11AM. Mt Willard is a 3.1-mile out-and-back trail near Crawford Notch. It takes an average of 1 h 50 min to complete. The summit provides excellent views of the stunning Crawford Notch and Southern Presidential Range. Please come prepared with your own backpack, food, water, and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. href="https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/new-hampshire/mount-willard">More Info

summary: Newbie Shoot at Porcfest Joshua Holmes, Tony Lekas, Chris Shepard [FSBL]
description:
For Whom: This event is for kids, parents, and visitors from out of state who haven’t yet learned how to shoot a gun.

Bringing your own firearm is allowed, if you do you may be asked to wait until all the Newbies have had a turn before shooting.
Description: The Newbie Shoot at Porcfest provides the opportunity to shoot a gun in a safe, fun environment. We will be shooting .22 caliber firearms with targets at close range to teach firearms safety, etiquette and marksmanship.
Organizer: Joshua Holmes, Josh Holmes is a shooting and safety instructor with decades of experience teaching Boy Scouts, in the Army and running several of the Newbie Shoots at past festivals.
Instructor: Tony Lekas, Tony Lekas has been a state representative and an NRA-certified firearms instructor for many years.
Host: Chris Shepard, Chris has generously donated the use of his private shooting range, be sure to tell him "thank you!"
When: Fri, 10:00A (180m)
Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59
Note: We would like to thank Mark Warden of Porcupine Real Estate for generously sponsoring the Newbie Shoot this year!

*The shoot will be held off site at a private range. We will be meeting at the Free State Based tent to go over safety and carpool to the range from there.

summary: J6: Insurrection Pinball Machine - free to play Jon Linowes [FSBL]
description: For Whom: If you enjoy a good but serious laugh, glints of truth, freedom of speech, and a healthy distrust of government, please come check it out and have fun. Description: Experience the truth around the events of Jan 6 through this fullsized playable pinball table. Work through each Rally mode: Stop the Steal, Fake News, Peaceful Protest, Its a Setup, Babbitt Murder, Have Faith, and Political Prisoners. Earn bonuses for Free Speech and Dont Tread on Me. Aim to defeat Voter Fraud,  Covid Lockdowns and the DC Goulog. Includes over 200 real video and sound clips.  J6: Insurrection Pinball is an educational documentary game. It is an interactive multimedia exhibition project, not a commercial product. Free to play. Produced by Freedom Dawg Games, a NH based custom game and services company. Host: Jon Linowes, Owner and developer of Freedom Dawg Games When: Tue, 12:00P (510m) Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59 Note: WILL BE SET UP AT FSBL RV59 THROUGHOUT EACH DAY AND EVENING href="http://freedomdawg.com/">More Info

Polymer80 or competitor 80% Glock style frame

Barrel

Tools will be available, but feel free to bring your own drill/dremel.

summary: Infant/Toddler/pre-k/K daily meet up Michelle Rountree, Moira [play]
description: For Whom: Infant through age 6 and their families Description: Meet up in the park. Also learn where the pop-up playground will be for the day. Pop up playground geared for infants through age 6. : Michelle Rountree : Moira, Moira, Moira’s decision to become a mother was a pivotal moment in her life and because of this, in the spring of 2016, she began to develop the concept of a new business model to support childhood learning. This idea was born out of Moira’s desire to help other parents on their journey out of what currently passes for "education" and into something that empowered children to take leadership in their own learning process. By 2017, as a free local initiative, Moira started “Albany Pop-Up Adventure Playground” - a temporary play space filled with loose parts and objects designed to inspire imagination and creativity. By the time of the lockdowns, more than 700 people had attended the pop-ups, which Moira designed in her own local community as an opportunity for all children to have access to child-led play. When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m) Where: play: Playground, Playground href="https://youtu.be/Vc9nBmxQ8r4">More Info

Description: Family hang out at the playground while the sunsets. Icebreaker challenge: Pets. As you meet new people on the playground (or connect with old friends) ask if they have pets or a favorite animal! 

Bonus: bring a picture (or even better maybe your friendly pet (with adult permission and supervision)....come on- we've all seen the PF goats, chinchillas, dogs, cats, and more...now's the time to show them off!) 

Don't have a pet? There's no better time to have a pet rock, dragon or maybe you keep a troll? Or share the pet you wish you had. Ice breaker challenges always optional. We'd just love to meet you!
: StephAnie Buzzell

Where: play: Playground, Playground
Note: Pictures recommended. If you bring a live pet, YOU are responsible for direct supervision at all times. Adults, please be present to hold animals while children play. And to be sure your animal co-exists positively with the other creatures present.

summary: Natural Birth: Know Your Rights! Nikki Sunshine, Ranee LaPointe [play]
description:
For Whom: Parents, Parents-to-be
Description: Ranee LaPointe and Nikki Sunshine a midwife serving the liberty community in New Hampshire and surrounding states. In this discussion she will be unpacking bodily autonomy and legal rights in regards to everything pregnancy, birth, and beyond. She will also discuss key differences between hospital and homebirth and how to effectively navigate the system. Birthing in power is the first step to welcoming sovereign beings into the world!
: Nikki Sunshine
:  Ranee LaPointe,

Where: play: Playground, Playground

Description: Join Nikki Sunshine in a yoga class geared for kiddos over 5 years old. Parents are welcome and encouraged to participate! In this class. We will be exploring different poses and meditations in a fun and age-appropriate way.

summary: Summer Solstice Ceremony Devin Rogers and Danny Panzella-Velez [Gaz]
description: For Whom: All that wish to honor life Description: Join New Vinland and Sovereign Love at the Gazebo on the west side of the campground to celebrate the summer solstice. We will thank the sun, nature and Balder a Norse God of beauty for wonders of life as the longest day of the year concludes at sunset. Leader: Devin Rogers and Danny Panzella-Velez When: Wed, 8:00P _(90m) Where: Gaz: Gazebo, PkLt href="spiritualvillage.online">More Info

For Whom: 1. People who struggle with an old injury that just won't go away. 2. People who work in a trade and are limited in what they can do because of an old injury. Athletes that have hit a limitation preventing them from reaching their next level. Description: There is typically a lot of confusion around how the structure of the human body works and what to do when there are injuries or pain and discomfort. Although I no longer Rolf full time, I have over 22 years of experience in the field of bodywork and love helping people understand how to take a leadership role in how they feel. Host: Moira Mills, After being raised Libertarian in rural Alaska my entire life, I have been in the field of wholistic health for over 20 years. While my focus has moved to innovation and business consulting now it is all built on my understanding of dynamic living systems, an understanding I have gained after many years of working with hundreds of clients. . href="https://rolf.org"> Website When: Tue, 8:00A _(45m) Where: ET: Enjoy Today!, RV30 Note: I will be offering a very limited number of sessions during the week. href="https://www.rolf.org/rolfing.php">More Info

For Whom: New to homeschool/unschool parents (or grandparents) or parents pulling their teens out for the first time. Description: There are a lot of people interested in child-led (unschool) learning but it can feel overwhelming and hard to get past your own programming if you went to public school yourself. I have never been to any school or had a textbook or a test in my hands and I'm happy to talk about it. Host: Moira Mills, Born to an English mother and a father who grew up as an American farm kid, Moira spent her childhood being unschooled (by Libertarian parents) on a farm in rural Alaska. This unorthodox upbringing has given Moira a unique appreciation for exploration and self-discovery that shapes her philosophy of childhood and how kids learn, and the important role of imagination and creativity. Moira’s decision to become a mother was a pivotal moment in her life and, because of this, in the spring of 2016 she began to develop the concept for a new business model. By the following year, as a local initiative of her online platform, Moira started “Albany Pop-Up Adventure Playground,” a temporary play space filled with loose parts and objects designed to inspire imagination and creativity. By the time of the plandemic, more than 700 people have attended the pop-ups, which Moira designed as an opportunity for all children to have access to child-led play in her own local community. In 2023 Moira and her son London moved to Chester, Vermont where a new chapter in their life is now unfolding.. href="https://linktr.ee/thelearningweb"> Website When: Wed, 8:00A _(45m) Where: ET: Enjoy Today!, RV30 href="https://linktr.ee/thelearningweb">More Info

For Whom: Hungry friends who enjoy a friendly Cajun feast!  Take out or join us at RV30.
Description: This year we'll be offering smaller Cajun Shrimp boils over several nights at RV30 (Enjoy Today!) 
We will be taking advance reservations, and interest will determine which nights it will be available.  Same as past two years - we'll have Cajun seasoned shrimp, potatoes, and corn.
Price is still to be determined - I expect it will be between $20-25 per person. 
This is NOT THE EVENT!  Stop by RV30 during the afternoon Monday thru Thursday to let us know your interest so that we can plan some meals.  The boils will not begin before Tuesday evening.  Sign up required - or - first come, first served!!

Host: Carolyn Urbanski, Former owner of Kirby's Q - long time PorcFest vendor and sponsor of Cajun Shrimp Boil in 2021 and 2022.
When: Mon, 1:00P (240m)
Where: ET: Enjoy Today!, RV30

Check out the Telegram link to see a list of books. https://t.me/MoiraMillsBooks Host: Moira Mills, https://thelearningweb.substack.com/p/coming-soon. href="https://t.me/TheLearningWeb"> Website When: Thu, 8:00A _(60m) Where: ET: Enjoy Today!, RV30 Note: Make sure you check out the telegram channel to see the list of books I'll have. @MoiraMills or https://t.me/MoiraMillsBooks href="https://t.me/MoiraMillsBooks">More Info

For Whom: Homeschooling parents and possibly kiddos if deemed appropriate by parent
Description: Buy expensive prefab curriculum books that aim to teach your child "everything"? NO. Outsource your child's brain to someone else? NO. Attend public school?? HELL NO! Let's get a round table going and explore the unorthodox methods, curricula, and techniques used in your house to make your specific homeschooling experience uniquely engaging for your kids! Let's pool our creative energies and share some of the clever tricks that produced big results in your family!
Host: Daniel Shortell, Agorist, Homeschooling Parent, Multiple business-owning Freedom Lover and Event-hosting Extraordinaire

For Whom: Conspiracy theorists who love pulling people down into their esoteric rabbit holes in search of truthy nuggets of deliciousness. Reality is the perception you create for yourself and others, everything else is a propagandist's sales pitch.

The host, Chapatis, will be offering discounted caffeine injections (by way of chai service) to ensure wide-eyed, mouth-foaming conspiracy loonies are living up to all the trite characterizations lobbed at them by the civilized normie-clique.
Description: You know you're a science-denying, fact-hating, shadow-banned, knuckle-dragging ape-of-a-subhuman piece-of-garbage that lurches from one fantastical lie to another like some sort of idiot-savant in search of the holy grail of lunacy....right? Or, perhaps you just don't trust authority and have a rational opinion that deviates from the given narrative. Well, if you do have some insights into uncommon, alternative narratives (yah, yah, we all know the earth is flat, the The Fed is a private corporation and the moon-landing was a Hollyweird production), please come and share them with your fellow knuckle-draggers!
Host: Daniel Shortell, Had a great showing for Conspiracy Social Hour last year, let's do it again! I, personally, am not really qualified for much....that is where you come in, mwaahahahaha

summary: The Pocket Guide To KILLING Gun Control! Alu Axelman [Alu]
description: For Whom: Anyone who believes in gun rights, self-defense, property rights, or liberty - or if you love gun control and are open to being talked out of it ;) Description: Do you hate guns? Are you afraid of them? Do you think that only government employees should be trusted to own such dangerous weapons? Do you think that we need laws to prohibit crazy or violent people from using guns to hurt others? Or are you looking for the best arguments to use with your anti-gun relatives, friends, and colleagues? In just a few minutes, this book will arm you with everything you need! Speaker: Alu Axelman, Elliot “Alu” Axelman lives in southern New Hampshire with his wife and son. Since creating The Liberty Block in 2017 as an extension of his radio show, the site has grown to become one of the preeminent pro-freedom & pro-independence publications in the world. Alu identifies as a voluntaryist and is very passionate about a multitude of liberty issues, including gun rights, taxation, education freedom, property rights, free speech, due process, and health freedom. Over the past few years, Alu has discovered that nearly every road to liberty leads to secession, so he has dedicated himself primarily to peaceful separation from the tyrants in DC. He currently serves as President of The Foundation for New Hampshire Independence and director & editor-in-chief of The Liberty Block. This is Alu’s ninth book. . href="AluAxelman.com"> Website When: Fri, 4:00P _(30m) Where: Alu: Alu's Amazing Books & The Liberty Block!, RV1 Note: This is my NEWEST BOOK pretty much being published and offered AT PORCFEST 2023!!!!! href="AluAxleman.com">More Info

summary: DEBATE: Does The US Constitution suck? Alu Axelman, Keith Bessette [Alu]
description: For Whom: Scholars, historians, constitutionalists, readers, debate fans Description: Alu Axelman takes the affirmative with Keith Bessette arguing the negative, in a debate based on Alu's recent book "The Constitution Sucks For Liberty" and the U.S. Constitution. Keith knows he might lose, as evidence shows it hasn't worked, but argues the document interpreted as the Founders wrote and intended it is pretty good on liberty. Debater: Alu Axelman, Alu's most recent book claims that the US Constitution is terrible for liberty. Alu has sold over 1,000 books and is a frequent speaker at Porcfest. He is the founder of The Liberty Block and current President of the Foundation for New Hampshire Independence.. href="LibertyBlock.com"> Website Debater: Keith Bessette, Rebel Civics show host on Unsafe Space, UncoverDC Writer, Reason Advocate, Critic of overreaching Government, Electrical and Systems Engineer, Punk Videographer When: Sat, 11:00A _(60m) Where: Alu: Alu's Amazing Books & The Liberty Block!, RV1

He has been speaking and writing about peaceful separation since 2017, and he has written 8 books about liberty and secession. summary: Exposing the Scam of "Gov't"... WIDELY...in NH! Etienne de la Boetie2 [Alu]
description: For Whom: FSP "Doers," Voluntaryists and Anarchists, Pre-Staters. Description: Art of Liberty Foundation founder Etienne de la Boetie2, the author of "Government" - The Biggest Scam in History... Exposed! will be talking about the Pre-State Project, the Foundation's plan to accelerate the goals of the Free State Project by widely exposing the illegitimacy and criminality of "government" WIDELY in New Hampshire. A "Pre-Stater" is someone who already lives in New Hampshire but shares the liberty goals of the Free State Project. Could we accelerate Liberty in NH by targeting the libertarian leaning already in the state? We are looking for the pre-staters in the FSP to help anchor a new organization and dispel the notion that the FSP are libertarian carpet-baggers. Speaker: Etienne de la Boetie2, Founder of the Art of Liberty Foundation and Author of "Government" - The Biggest Scam in History.. Exposed! . href="https://ArtOfLiberty.org/psp"> Website When: Sat, 1:00P _(60m) Where: Alu: Alu's Amazing Books & The Liberty Block!, RV1 href="ArtOfLiberty.org/PSP">More Info

For Whom: Anyone who bought their Porcupine Pop toy at Porcfest and wants to paint it on site! Description: Pick up your Porcfest XX exclusive Porcupine with AR-15 Pop Toy at the Unwoke Art tent (RV 213, ART on map) and then join us for a gather to paint your porcupine! This is an opportunity to customize your new toy in any way you like! Paints and paintbrushes will be provided. There is a very limited number of toys so make sure you pre-order yours at unwokeart.com! Host: Karlyn Borysenko, Karlyn Borysenko is the owner of Unwoke Art. href="https://unwokeart.com/products/exclusive-3d-printed-porcupine-with-ar-15-pop-toy-for-delivery-at-porcfest-only"> Website When: Fri, 2:00P _(60m) Where: Art: Unwoke Art, RV213 Note: You're welcome to pick up your toy anytime throughout the week! They will not be mailed out later! href="https://unwokeart.com/products/exclusive-3d-printed-porcupine-with-ar-15-pop-toy-for-delivery-at-porcfest-only">More Info

summary: Tiny Homes for Retirees, Preppers, & Grads Marco Capaldi [TnyH]
description: For Whom: Retiring, Homesteading, Prepping, or in Debt Description: Expert Talk Speaker: Marco Capaldi, Marco Capaldi 3rd yr Porcfest attendee and a business owner has helped over 30 people to date downsize to one level luxurious living. Inventor and Designer Tomek Sadowski a native of Poland is the OEM in Poland of a line of Galvanized Steel Framed Tiny Homes all built to high EU energy standards with radiant flooring and customizable modern materials and solar, wind, and battery options. These are designed with adding liveable space in stages and there is a free standing home office and spa model that can be added to an existing home on telescoping piers and in one day without molesting your yard and landscaping. Tom and Marco are committed to hiring Ukranian displaced workers in Poland to build these homes. Our system of install and one day delivery is award winning. Also our prices are as low as $250 a sq ft 1/3 of modern building costs. We also furnish them through our subsidiary as well as provide all appliances in our base package. . href="http://www.vitayhomes.com"> Website When: Tue, 10:00A (120m) Where: TnyH: Tiny Homes, Granny Podds, & ADU site, RV98 Note: Connect to Feasibility Study Experts and our Host supplier. Come kick the radiant tile. href="http://www.vitayhomes.com">More Info

summary: How to Use Firearms to Prevent Genocide Zephan [ATF]
description:
For Whom: Gun enthusiasts, those that distaste the evils that are commonplace under statist systems, history buffs, and more. 
Description: Democide (or death by government) was the leading cause of death during the 20th Century, responsible for 262 million deaths. The first thing tyrants come after are either the guns or speech (most often both). Learn how and why governments go after firearms first and what we can do to safeguard against government killings!
: Zephan
When: Tue, 11:00A _(30m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41

summary: Friendly Group visit to BFV (Body Freedom Village) Gaby Galvan, Jeff Y [ATF]
description:
For Whom: For people interested in checking out the Body Freedom Village but are too shy to go on their own, for those who want to visit BFV as a friendly group.
Description: Have you heard of the Body Freedom Village? It's awesome! Arguably the best hub at porcfest (IMO) but also the most controversial. Let's visit together. We'll meet at the ATF stand and walk over to BFV from there. Jeff Yunez will greet us and give us a tour. See you there!
Organizer: Gaby Galvan, During my first Porcfest in 2021, I heard about the body freedom village, and I was intrigued. Did I run right over to check it out? F*** no. I was shy. Still am. People kept saying how nice the BFV people were and how it wasn't a weird or disrespectful vibe. Nothing but good things. I finally got the courage to go with a buddy on the last night of porcfest that year. It was...perfect. I wished i had gone sooner. My freedom of expression includes being clothed, and yet I feel very comfortable at the BFV. I want to give you that opportunity to see if BFV is a good fit for you too. I'll be your BFV buddy :).
Host: Jeff Y, Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region!
When: Wed, 2:30P _(30m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: Schedule: We'll meet at the ATF stand at 2:30pm and start heading over to the BFV around 2:35pm. We'll arrive at BFV around 2:40pm. If you show up late to the ATF stand, please meet us at BFV, Gaby will be at BFV until 3pm and beyond. Jeff will give us a tour of the village and answer any questions we have. Then you could choose to stay and hang out and/or disperse. 
At 3:00pm BFV will have a boardgames event, and anyone is welcome to stay for that. Gaby will be staying for boardgames too.

All friendly bodies welcome; kids must be accompanied by a parent. BFV is a clothing-optional village. This and the boardgames event is family friendly.

summary: El Baile (The Mexican Dance Party) Gaby Galvan [ATF]
description:
For Whom: People who want to enjoy a Monday night rager (responsibly of course), people who want to dance to Mexican bangers
Description: I don't want to wait until later in the week to party at Porcfest, and I know you don't either. I'll be playing spanish dancing music only. All the can't stop dancing classics like "La Chona", "El Tucanaso", "La mesa...". etc. This is a "let's forget all our troubles and dance the night away" kind of party. 

Come as you are or come in your most Mexican party outfit, or in your "I feel like a sexy badass" party outfit. And get ready to do nothing but dance.

The ATF convenient store will be selling all the drinks you need to enjoy the night, or feel free to BYOD (Bring your own drinks).
Host: Gaby Galvan, Gaby is Mexican-American and grew up going to big fat Mexican ragers, and smaller more intimate Mexican ragers. They all had one thing in common, they were fun as F***. Her dad was a Mexican party DJ and is heavily inspiring the soundtrack for this party. 
When: Mon, 8:00P (180m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: 
Dress code: Come as you are, or in your most mexican party outfit, or in your most "im a sexy badass" party outfit

Mexican party outfit ideas:

any cowboy/cowgirl outfits

Women-
Any form fitting clothes
Going out top and jeans with cowboy boots or heels
dresses that are form fitting and/or show skin
cowboy hat

Men-
a nice button up shirt or polo shirt
nice jeans 
cowboy boots or nice sneakers
cowboy hat

For Whom: People who could talk about cooking all day, people who are interested in learning more recipes, people who would love to share some recipes they have.
Description: The perfect place to find the recipe you've been looking for. Bring your best recipe(s) that you are willing to share. Is there a recipe you've been dying to find? Maybe someone here will have just what you need. We will gather and talk about our favorite recipes and food to eat/make, and share any cooking tips we have amongst each other.

This will be a very informal gathering and you do not need to bring a physical copy of your recipes or even a digital copy. Just bring your brain, curiosity, and willingness to share and that will be enough to get us started.

Vegans and non-vegans may want to split off to share amongst themselves any vegan/non-vegan recipes. Whatever works :). 
Host: Gaby, Gaby loves cooking and could talk about it all day. Gaby is vegan and has been practicing the art of vegan cooking for 8 years. 
When: Tue, 12:00P _(60m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: Gaby will be compiling the recipes and making a digital 2023 Porcfest cookbook, and sharing amongst anyone who wants it. If you are not interested in having your recipes in the cookbook, that is okay.

summary: 20-something Libertarian's Campfire Gaby Galvan, Zephan Wood [ATF]
description:
For Whom: Libertarians in their 20's. 
Description: For libertarians in their 20's only. Let's gather around the campfire... away from those youngsters under 20, and those old farts over 29 (Lol). It's a chill kickback. 
Host: Gaby Galvan, Gaby is a 27 year old libertarian. 
Host: Zephan Wood, Zephan is a 25 year old libertarian.
When: Tue, 8:00P (120m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: Bring anything you want or nothing at all. Snacks, drinks, food to roast over the fire, guns, drugs, firewood, etc.

summary: Sourdough Starter How to: the laziest way Gaby Galvan [ATF]
description:
For Whom: Anyone interested in learning how to make their own sourdough starter the simplest way.
Description: Making sourdough starter is actually not that complicated. Last year, I learned how to make  a sourdough starter at Porcfest and my life has forever changed. I have found the easiest way to make sourdough starter and it's cheaper, easier and simpler than a lot of people make it out to be. Sure it's not as easy as set it and forget it, but as close as it can be. 

I predict there will be a lot of sourdough in your future after this how to. 
Host: Gaby Galvan, Gaby has been dabbling with making sourdough on and off for a year. She's lazy about it, but it's fine, and the bread turns out good.
When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41

summary: Women's Snack and Chat and Make up Gaby Galvan [ATF]
description:
For Whom: Women, women who are interested in make up, women who want to be around more feminine energy, women who like to snack, women who like to chat.
Description: It's basically an adult, daylight slumber party, without the pj's, (or maybe with the pj's). Bring your make up and your favorite snacks, and let's chat. Women only. We'll be doing our make up because it's fun and creative, and/or we'll be snacking, because yum. If you are new to make up bring your questions, someone will likely have answers.

To maintain cleanliness and skin safety, make up will likely not be shared, but who knows. 
Host: Gaby Galvan, Gaby is still kind of a noob with make up but has been practicing more and more. She loves food and just hanging out. 
When: Wed, 4:00P (120m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: Bring your own mirror.

summary: Get Your Porcfest Bucket List Gaby Galvan [ATF]
description: For Whom: Porcfest newbies, Porcfest veterans interested in a challenge, Porcfest veterans who want to switch it up Description: Are you new to Porcfest? Or maybe you've been here before but you want to change it up this year. Come and get your Porcfest bucket list to get the full Porcfest experience you've been looking for. You can have a hard copy of the list or be pointed in the direction of the digital copy. Feel free to get your list and leave or stay and ask any questions you have. Maybe you'll want to talk with others about what you are excited to check out. Organizer: Gaby Galvan, This is Gaby's 3rd Porcfest, she hasn't done everything but has a good idea of what the Porcfest experience entails. With contributions from other Porcfest veterans she has created this bucket with plenty of must-have experiences. When: Mon, 11:00A _(30m) Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41 href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/18opry0e92s3JrKr-mSDf1fmOjzys1rAXzDZ8VVNz3vw/edit?usp=sharing">More Info

For Whom: Introverts, introverts who feel like socializing, introverts who want to be around people who get it.
Description: Introverts get their energy from being alone, but that doesn't mean we don't like socializing. This meet up is introverts only, no extroverts. This gives us a chance to socialize with people who get it. No pressure. 

The rule will be that if you want to stop socializing at any moment, you can walk away, whether it's from a single person, a group of people, or the whole event. Whether it's mid conversation or mid awkward pause. Don't worry, we get it.
Host: Gaby Galvan, Gaby is a mega introvert. She loves spending her days alone at home being creative but also just watching TV (she watches too much honestly). She's also anti-social and might not even show up to this thing (lol). Jk, she'll definitely be there, and then she'll immediately run to the introvert's corner right after to recharge. See Gaby run. 
When: Wed, 7:00P _(60m)
Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41
Note: This is NOT at the introverts corner. The introverts corner is this awesome place you can go to to get away from it all and have some peace and quiet, without worrying about having to socialize. Please go there any time this week to recharge your introverted battery. You will find it under INV on your map.

For Whom: Extroverts who love making new introverted friends, extroverts who love making friends, introverts who want to make more friends, introverts who want to make friends with people who will easily initiate socializing, ambiverts who want to socialize with others and maybe find more ambiverts. Description: Inspired by the meme (see image). At this event there will be introverts, ambiverts, and extroverts. Scary, I know. Come find your new best friend. Extroverts: your role is to start the conversations, keep the conversations going, bring people together, help the introverts come out of their shell, be sensitive to their energy being easily drained by you Introverts: your role is to show up, be open to socializing, be open to letting people get to know you, be open to taking a step back when you need to, get to know others Ambiverts: y'all are still an enigma to me. Be exactly what feels right for you, start conversations, wait for others to start, take a step forward, take a step back Host: Gaby, Gaby is a mega introvert, and is married to an ambivert. She is practicing being a social butterfly, but she is not even a social caterpillar yet. . href="https://i.redd.it/5s0gr1tw5zuy.jpg"> Image When: Thu, 7:00P _(60m) Where: ATF: ATF Convenience Store, RV41 Note: Introverts: energized by alone time Extroverts: energized by time with other people Ambivert: Has qualities of both introvert and extrovert and switches modes depending on context (can adapt easily, consistent behavior) Oh my god, there's omniverts too?! Okay, an omnivert: a person who demonstrates the combined qualities of both introvert and extrovert at the same time (cannot adapt easily, inconsistent or unpredictable behavior) href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pn4ZdjznCyeVP0hFqR1c1GQgAvt6tbLnfD3llDU4Gc0/edit?usp=sharing">More Info

summary: Yes, It Fits: How to Pack and Travel Lightly Lazer Axelman [FA]
description:
For Whom: Anyone who travels extensively, wants to travel extensively, enjoys backpacking/camping trips, or is simply interested in learning how to use packing space efficiently. 
Description: Do you travel? Do heavy duffle bags, lost checked luggage, and long check-in lines not fit your definition of "a super fun time"? Do you imagine a month of travel with nothing but a backpack and laundry once or twice? Well, me too! I spent time in 16 countries last year, and six countries thus far in 2023 - I'm always seeking the lightest way to do so, and never thought much of it until three people asked me to teach them how I pack in the last month, so here I am! Come pack with me! 
Speaker: Lazer Axelman, I travel for work, live out of a variety of task-specific backpacks and duffles, and have been to 18 countries (most multiple times) spanning dozens of flights. Packing efficiently has become an art form to me. 
When: Wed, 12:00P _(30m)
Where: FA: Fr33 Aid, Penisula
Note: Feel very free to bring along your own backpacks and items, so we can learn while packing YOUR things efficiently, and give everyone an additional view (since I only own so many backpacks!)

For Whom: Parents/guardians of children age approx 5 to 16 Description: Join Michelle Levell, director of Granite State Home Educators (GSHE), for an open chat on all things about education freedom in NH. GSHE has extensive resources to help you maximize the freedom and flexibility of home education while minimizing government interference. We have tips to keep costs down and help you find your "tribe" and make new friends. Join Michelle on Friday 6/23 at noon and again on Saturday 6/24 at 1pm. Stop by her hub at RV site 118 Thursday through Sunday anytime you want to talk more. Facilitator: Michelle Levell, Michelle Levell has been active in state-level education issues and policy for nearly 20 years. She is the director and co-founder of Granite State Home Educators, an all-volunteer 501c4, statewide support organization with over 15,000 members. The GSHE website is widely considered the most extensive resource for New Hampshire homeschoolers with over 700 articles and nearly 50 pages. GSHE also manages seven different social media groups to support our community. Michelle has extensive experience as a volunteer-advocate working with legislators, national organizations, and grassroots activists on a wide range of education issues. She served as a full-time volunteer for the largest scholarship organization in the state for five years, helped launch a chartered public school, served on the board of a nonpublic school, and served on additional boards of directors for other NH-based nonprofits. She has first-hand experience with home education, online learning, gifted and 2e education, as well as private education. Her three children are now college graduates and employed in their chosen careers -- a public-school math teacher, a PhD candidate and research assistant in computational material science engineering, and another as a civil engineer.. href="https://granitestatehomeeducators.org/"> Website When: Fri, 12:00P _(60m) Where: Hive: Anie's Hive, Bingo href="https://granitestatehomeeducators.org/">More Info

Stop by her hub at RV site 118 Thursday through Sunday anytime you want to talk more. Facilitator: Michelle Levell, Michelle Levell has been active in state-level education issues and policy for nearly 20 years. The GSHE website is widely considered the most extensive resource for New Hampshire homeschoolers with over 700 articles and nearly 50 pages. GSHE also manages seven different social media groups to support our community. Michelle has extensive experience as a volunteer-advocate working with legislators, national organizations, and grassroots activists on a wide range of education issues. summary: The dark consequences of non-consensual education Michael South [Hive]
description:
For Whom: Parents, educators, or anyone interested in how we educate society and alternative solutions
Description: Exchange of goods without consent is theft.  Sex without consent is rape.  What should we call education without consent?  What should we expect to happen when we engage in it?  This talk will look at the highly negative consequences of using force instead of consent in education (specifically math, but relevant to any subject).  I will explain two different experiments that you've almost certainly never heard of that prove that forcing kids to learn math is unnecessary.  I will present a remarkable counter-thesis to the conventional wisdom:  mathematics is actually beautiful, intriguing, and enjoyable by almost everyone.
Speaker: Michael South, Michael South has a master's degree in applied mathematics, and began his career developing education technology and advocating for radical mathematics education reform.  He has been writing, observing, experimenting with, and thinking about what completely non-coercive mathematics education would look like for well over twenty years now.

Where: Hive: Anie's Hive, Bingo

description: For Whom: Parents, parents-to-be, caregivers, or anyone who wants to learn more about respectfully raising free kids in a follow orders world. While I love talking about all things parenting and education related- this topic is especially dear to my heart. Come learn how you can respectfully raise children WITHOUT coercion or threats (respecting their sovereign being) AND still foster healthy limits, boundaries and positive relationships....leading to a sustainable peace in your family (and future generations!) : StephAnie Buzzell, This is my family's 6th PorcFest and I'm especially excited to celebrate PFXX with all of you! During the year I strive to create a space where children are free to grow and learn through natural curiosity in a respectful, loving environment and parents feel connected, equipped, and empowered wherever they are on their parenting journey. Originally in MA, Anie’s Hive reopened in NH when our family made the move in 2021. Host: Carla San Diego, I started my career path with 15 years in the NYC fashion industry until the stress led to health issues that drove me to seek help beyond conventional medicine. That’s when I discovered Acupuncture and began to appreciate Chinese Medicine's holistic view of health and healing. Four years of graduate school later, I earned a Master of Science to become licensed, board-certified and practicing acupuncture and herbal medicine for the past decade. summary: Go on the Offensive Against Big Government Carla Howell [LP]
description:
For Whom: People who want to turn today’s political commentary on its head by going beyond merely playing defense against big government to moving our communities, our nation, and our world in the direction of small government. This is especially important for candidates, podcasters, and others who speak publicly. It's useful for any supporter of liberty.

Description: 
Speaker: Carla Howell, Carla Howell is a long-time small-government activist. She ran for office on the Libertarian ticket three times in Massachusetts, winning the endorsement of the Boston Herald in her race for state auditor (1998). She won 12% of the vote for U.S. Senate against Ted Kennedy (2000), almost beating the Republican.

In 2002, she ran for governor against Mitt Romney while championing her first statewide ballot initiative to end the income tax, which won 45% of the vote. She ran another initiative to end the income tax in 2008 and one to cut the state sales tax in 2010, which won almost one million votes.

In 2012, Carla Howell moved to Virginia where she served as Executive and Political Director for the Libertarian National Committee (2011-2017). She has coached hundreds of candidates and spokespersons for local, state, and federal campaigns across the country. She co-founded the Center For Small Government in 2005 and also composes libertarian songs which she has recorded and released.
When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: LP: Libertarian Party, RV61

summary: Go on the Offensive Against Big Government Carla Howell [LP]
description:
For Whom: People who want to turn today’s political commentary on its head by going beyond merely playing defense against big government to moving our communities, our nation, and our world in the direction of small government. This is especially important for candidates, podcasters, and others who speak publicly. It's useful for any supporter of liberty.
Description: 
Speaker: Carla Howell,  Carla Howell is a long-time small-government activist. She ran for office on the Libertarian ticket three times in Massachusetts, winning the endorsement of the Boston Herald in her race for state auditor (1998). She won 12% of the vote for U.S. Senate against Ted Kennedy (2000), almost beating the Republican.

In 2002, she ran for governor against Mitt Romney while championing her first statewide ballot initiative to end the income tax, which won 45% of the vote. She ran another initiative to end the income tax in 2008 and one to cut the state sales tax in 2010, which won almost one million votes.

In 2012, Carla Howell moved to Virginia where she served as Executive and Political Director for the Libertarian National Committee (2011-2017). She has coached hundreds of candidates and spokespersons for local, state, and federal campaigns across the country. She co-founded the Center For Small Government in 2005 and also composes libertarian songs which she has recorded and released.
When: Fri, 11:00A _(60m)
Where: LP: Libertarian Party, RV61
Note: Almost everywhere that you hear or see libertarian commentary (campaigns, speeches, think tanks, podcasts, TV, radio, etc.) it’s about what’s wrong with government.

Or it’s an attempt to stave off the latest proposal for more government.

In short, liberty advocates are playing defense. 

When all we do is play defense, the best possible outcome is we keep government big. The worst outcome is that government gets even bigger. More war. Fewer rights. More human suffering.

This is a losing strategy.

But when we go on the offensive, the worst possible outcome is we keep government big. The best outcome is that we actually move in the direction of small government. More freedom. More peace. People thrive.

In this session, you’ll learn how to be a champion for small government, with time for Q&A and some mock interviews.

For Whom: Gun nuts, Freedom fighters, Dennis haters (and lovers) Description: Show off your open carry and celebrate with us our natural right to carry at all times. We'll be adding a special "Sleeppy joe" limited-time menu item, available only at the time of the event , so come and grab one before we run out - and get a free side! In the American spirit - any gun owner that showcases their firearm gets a side of FULLY-LOADED fries (usually priced at $4) with every "Sleeppy joe" purchased for FREE. Hang out with us and talk shop about guns (and who has the biggest one), conspiracies about the Kennedys and how to prevent the feds from taking away our guns. Our exclusive "Sleeppy joe" sandwich - $8 Organizer: omer, Gun lover, natural rights enthusiast and cook When: Thu, 9:30A (180m) Where: F00D: Atlas Kitchen, RV145 Note: If you don't own a gun, come and join us in indulging in delicious food! href="t.me/AtlasKitchen">More Info

summary: Porcupine Chowdown - First Annual Eating Contest! Gil [F00D]
description: For Whom: Competitive autists, Free food enthusiasts, Fatties Description: This year will mark our first ever Porcupine Chowdown eating contest! Defeat other libertarians in winning a free $10 meal of burger, fries and an ice cream sandwich! Here are the rules: 1. You buy our burger and fries meal for $10 (this will be your entry ticket to the competition). 2. We time you as you eat - trying to beat the current record of the day. 3. Clock stops once you have a clean plate and an empty mouth. Whenever a new record is set we'll post an update on our Telegram channel. If you beat the record, you'll be the front runner to win your free meal, and may be the first ever winner of our famous first annual Chowdown! *If your time is beat you can come back and try again Organizer: Gil, Professional cook and full time fatty When: Fri, 10:00A (480m) Where: F00D: Atlas Kitchen, RV145 Note: Wanna see who won? Join our Telegram channel to keep updated on who won and other activities around our hub 💛 t.me/AtlasKitchen href="t.me/AtlasKitchen">More Info
